column5: Horned Helmet, Third Age, circa 2920
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Horned Helmet, Third Age, circa 2920"},{"descriptiong":"\"This helmet was once used by the Outcasts of Udûn for secret rituals. The horns and the leather were taken from the wild kine of Araw, hunted far from Mordor in the fields of Rhûn. It dates from a distant time when these men were prisoners of Gondor, made to toil on the construction of the Towers of the Teeth."},{"descriptiong":"Even now, the Outcasts remain mistrustful of those wearing metal armor. This helmet is a reminder of dark times past, a harbinger of darker times to come and a symbol of the Outcasts determination to never again live under the yoke of slavery.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"You've let me into your homes, you've let me into your lives, and now you bestow upon me your greatest honor."},{"descriptiong":"Though I come from The Black Gate, though I was once known to you as the enemy, I turn my back on Gondor. You people, you Outcasts, as you've been named, are people of honor, people of strength. I have found love within your tribe, but for your tribe as well. And you have taught me of a life I thirsted for, but never knew existed."},{"descriptiong":"Now it is my time to teach you. I will impart to you all my knowledge of war. The Orcs push us, but we will find strength and push back. And this land will be ours!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

[{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Coin, Gondor, Third Age, circa 2920"},{"descriptiong":"Merchants across Middle-earth know if it's Gondorian, it's good. And they freely accept these silver pieces (known as Castar) as currency, trading them across the civilized realms and with almost all the races of Middle-earth. This particular coin likely made its way into Mordor through that realm's primary trade route, the Sea of Núrnen."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"It's good. Coin of the realm."},{"descriptiong":"Sure, but it's the coin of Gondor's realm."},{"descriptiong":"If you don't want it…"},{"descriptiong":"I didn't say that, Cap'n. But how about a few less of these and a little more of that Elvish cloth you brought over from Eregion?"},{"descriptiong":"I think we can do that.\""},{"descriptiong":""},{"descriptiong":"(Celebrimbor's Commentary)"},{"descriptiong":"\"Wealth will not save Gondor. Uruks do not care for trinkets."},{"descriptiong":"Sauron will use gold to buy allies among the kingdoms of Men.\""},{"descriptiong":""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Memory Audio
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Lockpick, Second Age"},{"descriptiong":"This simple metal prod is a burglar's best friend. The pick is small and easily concealed; it can be palmed or even hidden under the tongue with minimal effort. In the hands of a skilled thief, the pick can be used to quickly and quietly defeat most locks of non-magical origin."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Sir, the situation is very confused…"},{"descriptiong":"How is it confused? I see the prisoners escaping, running towards the gates, which seem to have flown open by sorcery or sabotage."},{"descriptiong":"Archers, stand down!"},{"descriptiong":"Sir?"},{"descriptiong":"We're not wasting good arrows on those people. They've served their purpose: They're damned, they're damned well out of my hair. Mordor can take the whole stinking lot of them."},{"descriptiong":"And send my compliments to the captain of the gates. I suppose he sent me this lockpick as some sort of joke.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column3: Medallion Half 1, The Two Trees of Valinor
column5: Memory Audio
column6: Medallion Half 1, The Two Trees of Valinor
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Shattered Medallion Half, The Two Trees of Valinor, Second Age, circa 3430"},{"descriptiong":"Across Mordor the Two Trees of Valinor are recognized as a symbol of the light of creation and of the ancient bond between Elves and Men. This medallion half, crafted by the Elves, commemorates the original two trees of legend, whose scions now survive only in the White Tree of Gondor."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"All right… hold still. I'm afraid to say, it's going to…"},{"descriptiong":"Aaaaaaggggh!"},{"descriptiong":"…it's going to hurt."},{"descriptiong":"I've done all I can. We've called for one of your people, but I don't… in the meantime, why don't you tell me about that? The medallion you're holding…"},{"descriptiong":"You just want to distract me. Very well. These are the Two Trees of Valinor… a symbol of the endless cycle: Life, death, and rebirth. Come closer, and I will tell you their tale. We must…"},{"descriptiong":"…I fear we must distract ourselves from the grim happenings of this day.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Wooden Handle, formerly part of a mushroom basket, Third Age, circa 2930
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Wooden Handle, formerly part of a mushroom basket, Third Age, circa 2930"},{"descriptiong":"\"This utterly unremarkable basket has seen better days."},{"descriptiong":"Few, if any, of the Outcasts' possessions have survived. In bygone days, this basket would likely have been carried by a woman on her daily errands, and used to carry all manner of goods.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Stop! Do not move. By order of Gondor, trespassing on the Morannon is punishable by death!"},{"descriptiong":"Do not - a woman? The Outcasts now send women alone to steal from us."},{"descriptiong":"Do your worst, Ranger. But I will fight."},{"descriptiong":"You are but skin and bones…"},{"descriptiong":"I can still fight."},{"descriptiong":"Gather what you can and run. Quickly, before the others see you. You shouldn't be let to starve. Quickly, now. Go, go!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: The two left without saying a word. Only it was funny, like, because the shorter fellow left behind all his maps and the odd little board he used to see into the future. Traveling light, maybe, or maybe… I don't know, maybe he thought he'd have no more use for it."
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Mysterious star chart Bone, Late Second Age"},{"descriptiong":"Carved from the bone from an unknown animal of immense size, this map of the heavens was no doubt used by a Lore Master of some skill. Only a few select individuals would have been able to use this chart to track the course of the stars in the skies, using complex and, possibly, arcane computations to predict the future."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"…By that time we'd grown used to seeing them, but the shorter one had grown cold, distant. He could read the leaves, the lines in a man's hand, the bumps on his head. He could see, you know? And I guess it got to him. The knowing."},{"descriptiong":"They'd go off together, and you could tell when they met up with the Orcs. The sky would darken and there'd be hail, or rain, or winds that shook the trees. And then, sure enough, everything would clear. They never spoke about any of that, although we'd always want to know. \"\"Best not,\"\" they'd say."},{"descriptiong":"The two left without saying a word. Only it was funny, like, because the shorter fellow left behind all his maps and the odd little board he used to see into the future. Traveling light, maybe, or maybe… I don't know, maybe he thought he'd have no more use for it.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column3: Medallion Half 2, The Two Trees of Valinor
column5: The Elves of Eregion crafted wonderful medallions, tokens they carried into battle for inspiration and to remind themselves of their history. This particular artifact, representing the fabled Two Trees of Valinor, appears to have been split by a particularly wicked blade wielded by a powerful foe. Its missing half may have been carried off to distant lands.
column6: Medallion Half 2, The Two Trees of Valinor
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Shattered Medallion Half, The Two Trees of Valinor, circa 3430"},{"descriptiong":"The Elves of Eregion crafted wonderful medallions, tokens they carried into battle for inspiration and to remind themselves of their history. This particular artifact, representing the fabled Two Trees of Valinor, appears to have been split by a particularly wicked blade wielded by a powerful foe. Its missing half may have been carried off to distant lands."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"I'm sorry. His wound was too great. I had thought…"},{"descriptiong":"You stayed with him. It is enough."},{"descriptiong":"Here. He'd probably want you to have it. It's broken, but…"},{"descriptiong":"No, human. You keep it. These are ancient things, those trees. We watch them wither and die with the cold, but always they return. We see strength in their roots and hope as they stretch into the light. Let this token remind you of the Elf you tried to save, and of the bond between your people and mine.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Isn't it magnificent? Such detail! Look at me striking the mighty beast. Blood everywhere.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Scrimshaw, Third Age, circa 2940"},{"descriptiong":"This carved tusk commemorates the conclusion of an epic hunt. Here we see two Dwarves: the first is wielding a mighty axe and striking a deadly blow against a giant Mumak. The other, who appears to be his twin, flees from the beast in a panic. The quality of the workmanship indicates that the artist was a master craftsman under the influence of strong ale."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"There, it's finished… a true masterwork. What a fine carving. The front, I etched us killing this here Mûmak. And the back… our next prize, The Mighty Graug! A beast like that is a hunter's legacy."},{"descriptiong":"Show me the carving…"},{"descriptiong":"Isn't it magnificent? Such detail! Look at me striking the mighty beast. Blood everywhere."},{"descriptiong":"And why am I etched running away from the Mûmak in terror?"},{"descriptiong":"Artistic license, brother Torvin! If you want to be the hero, I suggest next time you make the carving!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: In-Game Description
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Mortar and pestle, possibly of Númenórean Origin, Second Age, circa 3261."},{"descriptiong":"A remarkable find, this artifact may date back to the Second Age, to the great Númenórean incursion wherein the Dark Lord Sauron willingly fell into captivity. It would likely have been used by a healer to grind roots and herbs in the creation of poultices and unguents required to keep an army hale and (relatively) healthy."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"The first messengers have rolled in to camp. They're reporting few casualties. We've struck a mighty blow against the forces of Mordor aligned against us."},{"descriptiong":"Let it be so, and not fools' idle chatter. Hegadorn! What news?"},{"descriptiong":"Haha! They say we have won a monumental victory! You'll not be needing all that Athelas you've been grinding, my friend. Few need healing on this day! And more's the wonder! They say the Golden King has brought back a prize - Sauron himself, wearing the heavy chains!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: You have grown fat on our generosity. We have fed you as we would a pet, allowed you to run unfettered. This ends now. Our union, as it was, has ended. Our will is irresistible. We have spoken."
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Crushed giant Spider egg shell, Third Age, circa 2938"},{"descriptiong":"\"This Ungol egg has clearly been kept as a memento, but for what reason? Does it represent yet another casualty in the burgeoning war in Mordor, the one being fought between the forces of Sauron and the children of Queen Shelob? Or is this just a remnant of some Uruk's supper?\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"I speak with the Mouth of Sauron, the second Dark Lord of this Middle-earth. Our will is his will. Mordor is ours, and fairly won. You will take this message from Sauron back to your spider Queen Shelob, the last daughter of Ungoliant."},{"descriptiong":"Your eggs will not be allowed to hatch in Mordor. Your children will no longer prey on the Morgai Flies. You will depart this realm, abandon your nests in Nan Ungol."},{"descriptiong":"You have grown fat on our generosity. We have fed you as we would a pet, allowed you to run unfettered. This ends now. Our union, as it was, has ended. Our will is irresistible. We have spoken.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: More'n a bit. He dead?
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Frolum's Ring, First Age."},{"descriptiong":"This ring was given to the unhappy bandit Frolum by his beloved wife as a symbol of their undying love. It was violently pulled from Frolum's hand, along with his index finger after his capture by the Dark Lord Sauron's minions. Sauron would use this ring to torment Frolum into betraying his comrades."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Who's this now?"},{"descriptiong":"Some unhappy bandit. Name's Frolum or Gorfab or something. He was screaming for his wife. The boys laid into 'im a bit."},{"descriptiong":"More'n a bit. He dead?"},{"descriptiong":"Naw. The boys know the big man's powerful livid and wants a word. This sack of dung might know where his thief pals are hiding."},{"descriptiong":"Strip him down. Take the ring, too, and give it to the boss; he likes that stuff. And when he wakes up…\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

[{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Iron Shackle, Second Age, circa 3436"},{"descriptiong":"\"These are prisoner's shackles, leg irons to be specific. They date back to the Second Age and were most likely worn by Gondorian captives, men and women whose involuntary servitude built the Towers of the Teeth flanking the Morannon."},{"descriptiong":"These captives would later throw off their shackles and begin a new life as Outcasts in Udûn. Some would keep their shackles to remind themselves of their hardship.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"All right, worms. Welcome to The Black Gate. You'll be building our watchtowers for us. Hard work will be rewarded."},{"descriptiong":"Sir, do you mean hard work will be rewarded with a shorter sentence?"},{"descriptiong":"You're traitors, the lot of you. Murderers and thieves. When I say rewarded, I mean I won't throw you to the Caragors.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Serpentine Blade, Orcish, Third Age, 2942
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Serpentine Blade, Orcish, Third Age, 2942"},{"descriptiong":"A deadly shiv, this serpentine blade has played a role in many betrayals. Uruk power struggles are legendary, weakness is not tolerated, and warriors move up in ranks by murdering their superiors. The Uruks have been roused by their recent successes in Mordor, and as the soldiers' ambition grows, weapons such as these are becoming more and more common."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Remember me, filth?"},{"descriptiong":"What the -"},{"descriptiong":"Change of plans, lads. I'm in charge, and we're gonna tear the Black Hand up."},{"descriptiong":"Don't you forget about me!"},{"descriptiong":"Ah, yeah, right. My, uh, memory's not that good.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Coded Journal Entry #2, Third Age, circa 2940
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Coded Journal Entry #2, Third Age, circa 2940"},{"descriptiong":"Clever, most clever… this note, written on parchment, seems to have been written with a previously heretofore undiscovered code. It appears to be neither a skip - nor a substitution code… could it be the note is ensorcelled?"},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"I wouldn't believe it if I hadn't seen it. But the Orcs here have an ally in the stinking flies."},{"descriptiong":"Mordor has its share of stiffs, and I had thought the flies were just getting their fill. But they're moving and attacking like one. Like they got a brain."},{"descriptiong":"I've tried to avoid 'em. They build nests everywhere and you can hear their buzzing all the time. The Orcs here seem to worship the pests, except, of course, when getting stung by 'em. The Orcs say they're spies? But who're they spying for? They aren't yours, are they?\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

[{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Cook's knife, Third Age, circa 2940"},{"descriptiong":"This Sigil (Knife) has seen much use. Originally it served an important ceremonial function in preparing ritual feasts. However since the invasion of Núrn by the Uruks every blade that can be turned into a weapon has been used by the Tribesmen in their resistance. The owner of this knife held it defiantly until the end."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Here, take this.  I want someone watching over Queen Marwen at all times. I am afraid she may do harm to herself. Now go."},{"descriptiong":"Mother, what is happening to you? Is this gift worth the price you are paying?"},{"descriptiong":"The end of Darkness is worth whatever price. Such is the spirit of Núrnen, Lithariel."},{"descriptiong":"Núrnen needs you, mother. These visions do not bring us enough benefit to befit your loss."},{"descriptiong":"But they do, my child. I have seen a vision of the Ring-maker, Celebrimbor himself. It is through him alone that Núrnen may be saved.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Memory Audio
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Ranger's Reading Primer, Third Age, circa 2915"},{"descriptiong":"The Rangers of Gondor are not just powerful warriors, they also perform a host of duties throughout the Kingdom. Depending on the circumstances, a Ranger may be called upon to serve as a mediator, a judge, a medic and, on occasion, even a teacher."},{"descriptiong":"Rangers have been known to carry basic Reading Primers and, during their stays in villages where opportunities for learning are scant, to select a few favored pupils and show them how to read and write."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"The memory point attached to the primer is of its original owner, Hirgon, teaching his Outcast lover, Eryn, to read:"},{"descriptiong":"Sound it out now…"},{"descriptiong":"FEE-AH-NOR… Fëanor. Why must you put me through this, Hirgon?"},{"descriptiong":"There's no one to blame but yourself. You begged me to teach you the words in my books."},{"descriptiong":"I regret that now. What use is the page here in Mordor?"},{"descriptiong":"Here. Look at this. A note for you."},{"descriptiong":"My love. Be… my… knife…"},{"descriptiong":"Try again."},{"descriptiong":"…Life?"},{"descriptiong":"Or wife."},{"descriptiong":"Wife? Yes, Hirgon. I am yours."},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: In-Game Description
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"\"This piece may have been commissioned by Men and crafted by the Dwarves. It is known the races traded freely between each other and, in turn, with the Elves."},{"descriptiong":"Many fine wares would find their way into Mordor via trade facilitated by the Sea of Núrnen. Such trade routes have closed, possibly with finality, with the return of the Uruks.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Isn't it lovely, dear? The Dwarves made this!"},{"descriptiong":"You've been drinking. You smell like a mule who's gotten into the rotgut."},{"descriptiong":"It's a fine anniversary present! Look at the craftsmanship!"},{"descriptiong":"Our anniversary was last week."},{"descriptiong":"It was brought in from the sea!"},{"descriptiong":"You mean you won this at the tavern. My husband. Get in the house.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: In-Game Description
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Iron Shackle, Second Age, circa 3436"},{"descriptiong":"\"These are prisoner's shackles, leg irons to be specific. They date back to the Second Age and were most likely worn by Gondorian captives, men and women whose involuntary servitude built the Towers of the Teeth flanking the Morannon."},{"descriptiong":"These captives would later throw off their shackles and begin a new life as Outcasts in Udûn. Some would keep their shackles to remind themselves of their hardship.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"All right, worms. Welcome to The Black Gate. You'll be building our watchtowers for us. Hard work will be rewarded."},{"descriptiong":"Sir, do you mean hard work will be rewarded with a shorter sentence?"},{"descriptiong":"You're traitors, the lot of you. Murderers and thieves. When I say rewarded, I mean I won't throw you to the Caragors.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Traditionally, the cup would be filled with bitter waters from the Sea of Núrnen, waters which would then be poured on an item or person as a blessing, or on the ground to give thanks. With Queen Marwen's mysterious malaise, the cup has been used in increasingly more bizarre and disturbing rites."
column7:
[{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Ritual Cup, Third Age, circa 2941
"A relic of the free Men of Núrn, this cup would be used in many rituals, including consecration ceremonies and matrimonies."},{"descriptiong":"Traditionally, the cup would be filled with bitter waters from the Sea of Núrnen, waters which would then be poured on an item or person as a blessing, or on the ground to give thanks. With Queen Marwen's mysterious malaise, the cup has been used in increasingly more bizarre and disturbing rites.""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":""By the white waters of the river Anduin,
By the colors so many they burn bright,
May Núrnen now look to Marwen,
To my gift of second sight."},{"descriptiong":"May the elements of earth, fire, air,
Form gateway to worlds unseen,
Spirits of Valinor hear my prayer,
And grant great power new to the Shore's Queen.""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: This glassy, obsidian stone is one of those volcanic rocks; it dates back to the Second Age, perhaps to when the Dark Lord formed his initial bond with the volcano. These remnants of Orodruin's fury are prized for their hardness. They are often sharpened to make weapons."
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Strange Rock (volcanic) Second Age, circa 1600"},{"descriptiong":"\"Orodruin's eruptions are sudden and violent. When the mountain awakes in fire, none are safe. The skies darken with smoke and ash, and fiery rocks are shot high into the air before landing with deadly force."},{"descriptiong":"This glassy, obsidian stone is one of those volcanic rocks; it dates back to the Second Age, perhaps to when the Dark Lord formed his initial bond with the volcano. These remnants of Orodruin's fury are prized for their hardness. They are often sharpened to make weapons.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Where'd you get off to, child?"},{"descriptiong":"I found this, daddy."},{"descriptiong":"This kind of rock is very rare. It comes from the volcano. There!"},{"descriptiong":"Now, Doom is a foul place, angry and mean. It will explode when Sauron is near and plotting, spitting all manner of foulness into the air: smoke and dust and rocks that burn the ground. It does this as a warning: I will not stay silent for long!"},{"descriptiong":"Sort of like your mother."},{"descriptiong":"Don't tell your mother I said that."},{"descriptiong":"So this rock is…"},{"descriptiong":"It is a rock, nothing more. And you needn't be afraid of a rock. Or Doom, which is silent to this very day."},{"descriptiong":"And, sweetie, if you need a lesson from all this, why, here's a fine one: Even a foul place like that volcano can produce beautiful things.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Dead Crow carrying Coded Journal Entry #1
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Dead Crow carrying Coded Journal Entry #1"},{"descriptiong":"\"The skies over Mordor are being cleared by fell beasts, the Hell-hawk. Crows such as this poor fellow are hunted relentlessly, but not as food."},{"descriptiong":"No, crows are hunted because each of the oversized black birds is a potential spy, a messenger who might be carrying news to a master outside of Mordor. This crow met its doom trying to deliver a coded note.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Here's what I saw: I told you the Orcs are digging everywhere. Well, they dug huge caves into the ground in the side of the hills and into the mountains where they do their work. Some of it is forges, and they've got blacksmiths making armor and all kinds of weapons. They save on metal by making their armor for the front only, like they're not planning on retreating anymore."},{"descriptiong":"Oh, and they've got these huge pits, too, bigger'n I've ever seen. They pull the new Orcs, maybe a hundred or so a day, and some of them are those Uruk-hai. You can tell them right away because they've got a head or so on other Orcs, they come out fighting, and immediately start bossing everyone else around."},{"descriptiong":"No-one's the wiser about me spying. But don't send no more crows! The other Orcs might get suspicious.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: I was going to scout Thaurband, the slave city. The Orcs got a prison there, and enough people in chains to run the mines and the mills and make the city go. But there it was, one stinking fly. I could hear it buzzing, but couldn't see it or squash it.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Coded journal entry #3, Third Age, circa 2941"},{"descriptiong":"This parchment contains a note, but its author and intended recipient remain, ultimately, unrevealed. Is this a dispatch of some kind? A recounting of great deeds? Poetry? The note is coded and its message remains indecipherable."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"The damn flies seem to be following me. I can't hardly go nowhere without them buzzing around."},{"descriptiong":"I was going to scout Thaurband, the slave city. The Orcs got a prison there, and enough people in chains to run the mines and the mills and make the city go. But there it was, one stinking fly. I could hear it buzzing, but couldn't see it or squash it."},{"descriptiong":"Thing was following me, I swear. I was out on a skiff, middle of the Sea of Núrnen and the fly was coming along for the ride. Like it knew! Following me, like. All the time: ZZZZZ ZZZZZ."},{"descriptiong":"I can't get the buzzing and humming to stop. It don't matter whether I'm sleeping or eating or squatting. I can hear 'em. They're in my damned head!"},{"descriptiong":"MAKE… 'EM… STOP!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: It shan't do either. You'll need to ground it up for its healing properties.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Musty Tome, Third Age, circa 2890\n\"This almanac has been bound in leather and appears to be more than a century old. The writing within is a compilation of history, poetry and translation from across Middle-earth. It gathers together works of antiquity from the Great Realms of Gondor, Arnor and Númenor and even some samples of songs from the distant Halflings."},{"descriptiong":"The most curious entry is the \"Lament\", a work of metered verse whose controversial origin has been debated among scholars for many years; it has been suggested by some that its author was an Ent, one of the ancient Shepherds of the Trees.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Are you Athelas or Hithlas? Why can't I find anything in this almanac? Well… only one way to be sure. Cheers. *swallows* And now I wait. This'll either cure my fever or I'll be dead in seconds."},{"descriptiong":"It shan't do either. You'll need to ground it up for its healing properties."},{"descriptiong":"You… the Outcast woman…"},{"descriptiong":"I'm Eryn. I never got to thank you, Ranger. There are but few of your kind on the Black Gate."},{"descriptiong":"Duty clouds kindness in these parts. It's why I deserted. I'm Hirgon.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Strip him down. Take the ring, too, and give it to the boss; he likes that stuff. And when he wakes up…"
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Frolum's Ring, First Age."},{"descriptiong":"This ring was given to the unhappy bandit Frolum by his beloved wife as a symbol of their undying love. It was violently pulled from Frolum's hand, along with his index finger after his capture by the Dark Lord Sauron's minions. Sauron would use this ring to torment Frolum into betraying his comrades."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Who's this now?"},{"descriptiong":"Some unhappy bandit. Name's Frolum or Gorfab or something. He was screaming for his wife. The boys laid into 'im a bit."},{"descriptiong":"More'n a bit. He dead?"},{"descriptiong":"Naw. The boys know the big man's powerful livid and wants a word. This sack of dung might know where his thief pals are hiding."},{"descriptiong":"Strip him down. Take the ring, too, and give it to the boss; he likes that stuff. And when he wakes up…\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: But they do, my child. I have seen a vision of the Ring-maker, Celebrimbor himself. It is through him alone that Núrnen may be saved."
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Cook's knife, Third Age, circa 2940"},{"descriptiong":"This Sigil (Knife) has seen much use. Originally it served an important ceremonial function in preparing ritual feasts. However since the invasion of Núrn by the Uruks every blade that can be turned into a weapon has been used by the Tribesmen in their resistance. The owner of this knife held it defiantly until the end."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Here, take this.  I want someone watching over Queen Marwen at all times. I am afraid she may do harm to herself. Now go."},{"descriptiong":"Mother, what is happening to you? Is this gift worth the price you are paying?"},{"descriptiong":"The end of Darkness is worth whatever price. Such is the spirit of Núrnen, Lithariel."},{"descriptiong":"Núrnen needs you, mother. These visions do not bring us enough benefit to befit your loss."},{"descriptiong":"But they do, my child. I have seen a vision of the Ring-maker, Celebrimbor himself. It is through him alone that Núrnen may be saved.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Sauron will use gold to buy allies among the kingdoms of Men."
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Coin, Gondor, Third Age, circa 2920"},{"descriptiong":"Merchants across Middle-earth know if it's Gondorian, it's good. And they freely accept these silver pieces (known as Castar) as currency, trading them across the civilized realms and with almost all the races of Middle-earth. This particular coin likely made its way into Mordor through that realm's primary trade route, the Sea of Núrnen."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"It's good. Coin of the realm."},{"descriptiong":"Sure, but it's the coin of Gondor's realm."},{"descriptiong":"If you don't want it…"},{"descriptiong":"I didn't say that, Cap'n. But how about a few less of these and a little more of that Elvish cloth you brought over from Eregion?"},{"descriptiong":"I think we can do that.\""},{"descriptiong":""},{"descriptiong":"(Celebrimbor's Commentary)"},{"descriptiong":"\"Wealth will not save Gondor. Uruks do not care for trinkets."},{"descriptiong":"Sauron will use gold to buy allies among the kingdoms of Men.\""},{"descriptiong":""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column3: Weathered Azurite Figurine, The Two Istari
column5: I heard them say they were hunting the darkness. Damned if I know if they found it. But I guess those fellows can find trouble when they're looking for it."
column6: Weathered Azurite Figurine, The Two Istari
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Weathered Azurite Figurine, the Blue Istari, Late Second Age"},{"descriptiong":"This crudely carved figurine depicts two enigmatic wizards who came to Mordor hunting a great evil. Although the pair likely never escaped the cursed realm, their exploits were well detailed and may have inspired the creation of magical cults throughout Middle-earth."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"See, there were two of them, and they both came in from the road with a hard look in their eyes, as if they'd traveled too far and seen too much. They were Wizards, true, both of 'em caked in dust, and when one'd talk he'd stop to think and there'd be the other to finish right up, like they had one brain and two mouths. It was creepy for sure, but neither seemed to notice."},{"descriptiong":"I heard them say they were hunting the darkness. Damned if I know if they found it. But I guess those fellows can find trouble when they're looking for it.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column3: Medallion Half 2, The Two Trees of Valinor
column5: Shattered Medallion Half, The Two Trees of Valinor, circa 3430
column6: Medallion Half 2, The Two Trees of Valinor
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Shattered Medallion Half, The Two Trees of Valinor, circa 3430"},{"descriptiong":"The Elves of Eregion crafted wonderful medallions, tokens they carried into battle for inspiration and to remind themselves of their history. This particular artifact, representing the fabled Two Trees of Valinor, appears to have been split by a particularly wicked blade wielded by a powerful foe. Its missing half may have been carried off to distant lands."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"I'm sorry. His wound was too great. I had thought…"},{"descriptiong":"You stayed with him. It is enough."},{"descriptiong":"Here. He'd probably want you to have it. It's broken, but…"},{"descriptiong":"No, human. You keep it. These are ancient things, those trees. We watch them wither and die with the cold, but always they return. We see strength in their roots and hope as they stretch into the light. Let this token remind you of the Elf you tried to save, and of the bond between your people and mine.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Memory Audio
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Fragment, Wooden Walking stick, early Third Age."},{"descriptiong":"Some great force rent this Wizard's staff asunder. Fashioned from a sapling, this gnarled staff served as walking stick, magical rod and weapon for a wandering Wizard. What became of its owner and how it was broken is a mystery."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Funny thing, that. They told us their names, plenty of times. But we all forgot. To a man, we forgot. It was like they didn't want us remembering. After a while, they were just the Two Istari, and sometimes, the big one and the little one."},{"descriptiong":"Can't say how I can't remember. I remember the bigger one telling us stories of a Goblin city, of a man who could turn himself into a bear, of the time when… well, I guess it didn't matter too much to him that some of his stories needed some cleaning up, or would scare a dead man out of his grave."},{"descriptiong":"When the bigger one left, he took his cane. But he left a walking stick behind, with all these little notches cut into it. He was keeping track of something, for sure.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: They carried with them what they could; beyond their physical possessions, the tools and the trinkets, they also carried with them their shared dreams for a better life. Their land was consumed, but they would live on. And their relics are spread throughout Middle-earth."
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Gardening Hoe Blade, Third Age, circa 2920"},{"descriptiong":"\"Númenóreans carried a great many things with them in their great diaspora. Their journey was long and perilous, and not all who undertook it lived to see their new homes."},{"descriptiong":"They carried with them what they could; beyond their physical possessions, the tools and the trinkets, they also carried with them their shared dreams for a better life. Their land was consumed, but they would live on. And their relics are spread throughout Middle-earth.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"The first line in the actoul audio without reading meant to say \"He's in jail for a reason\"\n\"He's in gaol for a reason."},{"descriptiong":"For saying what we're all thinking?"},{"descriptiong":"You want to live forever? Plowing this field?"},{"descriptiong":"The Elves lord it over us! Don't they just? Sauron's right. We can live without pain, without growing old."},{"descriptiong":"And you want to go to war to make that happen?"},{"descriptiong":"I want the king to listen to good ideas!"},{"descriptiong":"Well, then, he should have nothing to do with Sauron. Fighting with the Elves is not a bad idea. It's the worst idea imaginable.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Can't say how I can't remember. I remember the bigger one telling us stories of a Goblin city, of a man who could turn himself into a bear, of the time when… well, I guess it didn't matter too much to him that some of his stories needed some cleaning up, or would scare a dead man out of his grave.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Fragment, Wooden Walking stick, early Third Age."},{"descriptiong":"Some great force rent this Wizard's staff asunder. Fashioned from a sapling, this gnarled staff served as walking stick, magical rod and weapon for a wandering Wizard. What became of its owner and how it was broken is a mystery."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Funny thing, that. They told us their names, plenty of times. But we all forgot. To a man, we forgot. It was like they didn't want us remembering. After a while, they were just the Two Istari, and sometimes, the big one and the little one."},{"descriptiong":"Can't say how I can't remember. I remember the bigger one telling us stories of a Goblin city, of a man who could turn himself into a bear, of the time when… well, I guess it didn't matter too much to him that some of his stories needed some cleaning up, or would scare a dead man out of his grave."},{"descriptiong":"When the bigger one left, he took his cane. But he left a walking stick behind, with all these little notches cut into it. He was keeping track of something, for sure.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: The memory point attached to the primer is of its original owner, Hirgon, teaching his Outcast lover, Eryn, to read:
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Ranger's Reading Primer, Third Age, circa 2915"},{"descriptiong":"The Rangers of Gondor are not just powerful warriors, they also perform a host of duties throughout the Kingdom. Depending on the circumstances, a Ranger may be called upon to serve as a mediator, a judge, a medic and, on occasion, even a teacher."},{"descriptiong":"Rangers have been known to carry basic Reading Primers and, during their stays in villages where opportunities for learning are scant, to select a few favored pupils and show them how to read and write."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"The memory point attached to the primer is of its original owner, Hirgon, teaching his Outcast lover, Eryn, to read:"},{"descriptiong":"Sound it out now…"},{"descriptiong":"FEE-AH-NOR… Fëanor. Why must you put me through this, Hirgon?"},{"descriptiong":"There's no one to blame but yourself. You begged me to teach you the words in my books."},{"descriptiong":"I regret that now. What use is the page here in Mordor?"},{"descriptiong":"Here. Look at this. A note for you."},{"descriptiong":"My love. Be… my… knife…"},{"descriptiong":"Try again."},{"descriptiong":"…Life?"},{"descriptiong":"Or wife."},{"descriptiong":"Wife? Yes, Hirgon. I am yours."},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Sure, but it's the coin of Gondor's realm.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Coin, Gondor, Third Age, circa 2920"},{"descriptiong":"Merchants across Middle-earth know if it's Gondorian, it's good. This particular coin likely made its way into Mordor through that realm's primary trade route, the Sea of Núrnen."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"It's good. But how about a few less of these and a little more of that Elvish cloth you brought over from Eregion?"},{"descriptiong":"I think we can do that.\""},{"descriptiong":""},{"descriptiong":"(Celebrimbor's Commentary)"},{"descriptiong":"\"Wealth will not save Gondor. Uruks do not care for trinkets."},{"descriptiong":"Sauron will use gold to buy allies among the kingdoms of Men.\""},{"descriptiong":""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: You are but skin and bones…
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Wooden Handle, formerly part of a mushroom basket, Third Age, circa 2930"},{"descriptiong":"\"This utterly unremarkable basket has seen better days."},{"descriptiong":"Few, if any, of the Outcasts' possessions have survived. In bygone days, this basket would likely have been carried by a woman on her daily errands, and used to carry all manner of goods.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Stop! Do not move. By order of Gondor, trespassing on the Morannon is punishable by death!"},{"descriptiong":"Do not - a woman? The Outcasts now send women alone to steal from us."},{"descriptiong":"Do your worst, Ranger. But I will fight."},{"descriptiong":"You are but skin and bones…"},{"descriptiong":"I can still fight."},{"descriptiong":"Gather what you can and run. Quickly, before the others see you. You shouldn't be let to starve. Quickly, now. Go, go!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Clever, most clever… this note, written on parchment, seems to have been written with a previously heretofore undiscovered code. It appears to be neither a skip - nor a substitution code… could it be the note is ensorcelled?
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Coded Journal Entry #2, Third Age, circa 2940"},{"descriptiong":"Clever, most clever… this note, written on parchment, seems to have been written with a previously heretofore undiscovered code. It appears to be neither a skip - nor a substitution code… could it be the note is ensorcelled?"},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"I wouldn't believe it if I hadn't seen it. But the Orcs here have an ally in the stinking flies."},{"descriptiong":"Mordor has its share of stiffs, and I had thought the flies were just getting their fill. But they're moving and attacking like one. Like they got a brain."},{"descriptiong":"I've tried to avoid 'em. They build nests everywhere and you can hear their buzzing all the time. The Orcs here seem to worship the pests, except, of course, when getting stung by 'em. The Orcs say they're spies? But who're they spying for? They aren't yours, are they?\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: They're on the move for sure.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Excavator Cog, Third Age, circa 2939"},{"descriptiong":"\"This cog was spit from one of the great Uruk war machines, perhaps an excavator. As the Uruks push farther and farther into Mordor, they have torn up the land seeking resources to fuel their Dark Lord's massive war effort."},{"descriptiong":"Excavators churn the ground to uncover metal for the forges, clay for the kilns, and any artifacts, weapons, or tools that might be of use.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Here! Found it in Udûn."},{"descriptiong":"What is it?"},{"descriptiong":"They got these machines, see? And they're digging up everything in Udûn. The thing tears the land up, then the slaves pick through everything. Clay and mud go to the kilns. If they find metal, that goes to the forges. Anything they can use they take back. And if they find an old weapon or piece of armor, they hand it off to the Uruk-hai, the big'uns. Maybe to study, maybe to wear, I don't know."},{"descriptiong":"Hm…"},{"descriptiong":"They're on the move for sure."},{"descriptiong":"We must know what is happening in Mordor. We have other eyes there, but yours are sharp. You serve us well."},{"descriptiong":"You will return there and report back. The council must not learn of your actions. Do not get caught.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

[{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Whetstone, Third Age"},{"descriptiong":"Among the millions of volcanic rocks to be found within the mountainous borders of Mordor, this stone is unique. It is a Dwarven Whetstone, used to sharpen axes, knives and swords to a keen edge that will cut through even the toughest Uruk armor or the stony skin of a Troll."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"'It's the keen edge what cuts the mountain,' as the saying goes. Whoever the stone's user was, he was most thorough in his efforts."},{"descriptiong":"\"Keep sharpening! You've got to hone yer axe until its edge can split one of yer beard hairs in two."},{"descriptiong":"Aw, it's sharp enough to kill a Graug. Now, pass me the pipe…"},{"descriptiong":"'Sharp enough' ain't what the hunt's about, little brother! You've got to learn to respect the hunt. A keen blade for a clean kill. Without respect for the beast, we're no better than the Orcs. Now, let's give 'er a test…"},{"descriptiong":"Fer Durin, give a Dwarf fair warning when ya yank hairs from his beard!"},{"descriptiong":"Look, at this, Torvin! Split the hair in two! There's hope for you yet!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column3: Medallion Half 2, The Two Trees of Valinor
column5: In-Game Description
column6: Medallion Half 2, The Two Trees of Valinor
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Shattered Medallion Half, The Two Trees of Valinor, circa 3430"},{"descriptiong":"The Elves of Eregion crafted wonderful medallions, tokens they carried into battle for inspiration and to remind themselves of their history. This particular artifact, representing the fabled Two Trees of Valinor, appears to have been split by a particularly wicked blade wielded by a powerful foe. Its missing half may have been carried off to distant lands."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"I'm sorry. His wound was too great. I had thought…"},{"descriptiong":"You stayed with him. It is enough."},{"descriptiong":"Here. He'd probably want you to have it. It's broken, but…"},{"descriptiong":"No, human. You keep it. These are ancient things, those trees. We watch them wither and die with the cold, but always they return. We see strength in their roots and hope as they stretch into the light. Let this token remind you of the Elf you tried to save, and of the bond between your people and mine.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Bah, that old thing. Time to get rid of that rag. Barely keeps the Pipeweed dry.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Pipeweed Pouch, Spider's Venom Sac, Third Age, Circa 2941"},{"descriptiong":"The pleasant smell of Pipeweed emanates from this oversized pouch. The owner of this pouch harvested both the leaves and flowers of the Pipeweed plant in equal measure; the leaves are commonly dried and smoked in pipes and the flowers chewed to create a potent narcotic. As for the pouch itself, it appears to have come from the poison sac of an Ungol."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Careful with the pouch, Torvin! It almost went in the fire."},{"descriptiong":"Bah, that old thing. Time to get rid of that rag. Barely keeps the Pipeweed dry."},{"descriptiong":"It is a rag, brother… and I'll keep this souvenir from our first hunt till it turns to dust. Remember us tracking that Great Spider through Mirkwood nearly sixty years ago - then drawing her out using live bait."},{"descriptiong":"Yes, but, why do I always have to be the bait?"},{"descriptiong":"You have a quality. You make things want to kill you. It's a gift really."},{"descriptiong":"But Torvin, this was your first kill. Ours together. It's what made you a hunter. And I'll treasure it always, brother!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "Bad news has wings," the saying goes. So it was with the dispatches from Erebor, heralding the Orcs' great defeat at the Battle of the Five Armies. This particular scroll made its way into Mordor carried by a messenger whose ill tidings were received less than warmly by his comrades. Though the courier's identity was never revealed, he was referred to by the Uruks, with great affection, as 'dinner.'
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Herald's parchment, Third Age, 2941"},{"descriptiong":"\"Bad news has wings,\" the saying goes. So it was with the dispatches from Erebor, heralding the Orcs' great defeat at the Battle of the Five Armies. This particular scroll made its way into Mordor carried by a messenger whose ill tidings were received less than warmly by his comrades. Though the courier's identity was never revealed, he was referred to by the Uruks, with great affection, as 'dinner.'"},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"It's never good news.\nNaw, and I saw to it he didn't…"},{"descriptiong":"All right, you stinking lot. Shut your gobs."},{"descriptiong":"SHUT IT!"},{"descriptiong":"Got some terrible news, here. Terrible. Once again the filthy Humans sided with the Dwarves who had help from those sanctimonious bastards the Elves who were rescued by - and I am not making this up - the damned giant Eagles to slaughter thousands of our brethren in what we should all be calling the battle to unfairly gang up on the Orcs."},{"descriptiong":"Our lands get invaded, our chieftains killed, and our people murdered. Where does it end? Well, I tell you, it ends here. And it ends right now! They can't stop the march of progress. They can't stop us!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

[{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Fragment, Wooden Walking stick, early Third Age."},{"descriptiong":"Some great force rent this Wizard's staff asunder. Fashioned from a sapling, this gnarled staff served as walking stick, magical rod and weapon for a wandering Wizard. What became of its owner and how it was broken is a mystery."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Funny thing, that. They told us their names, plenty of times. But we all forgot. To a man, we forgot. It was like they didn't want us remembering. After a while, they were just the Two Istari, and sometimes, the big one and the little one."},{"descriptiong":"Can't say how I can't remember. I remember the bigger one telling us stories of a Goblin city, of a man who could turn himself into a bear, of the time when… well, I guess it didn't matter too much to him that some of his stories needed some cleaning up, or would scare a dead man out of his grave."},{"descriptiong":"When the bigger one left, he took his cane. But he left a walking stick behind, with all these little notches cut into it. He was keeping track of something, for sure.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Fragment, Wooden Walking stick, early Third Age.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Fragment, Wooden Walking stick, early Third Age."},{"descriptiong":"Some great force rent this Wizard's staff asunder. Fashioned from a sapling, this gnarled staff served as walking stick, magical rod and weapon for a wandering Wizard. What became of its owner and how it was broken is a mystery."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Funny thing, that. They told us their names, plenty of times. But we all forgot. To a man, we forgot. It was like they didn't want us remembering. After a while, they were just the Two Istari, and sometimes, the big one and the little one."},{"descriptiong":"Can't say how I can't remember. I remember the bigger one telling us stories of a Goblin city, of a man who could turn himself into a bear, of the time when… well, I guess it didn't matter too much to him that some of his stories needed some cleaning up, or would scare a dead man out of his grave."},{"descriptiong":"When the bigger one left, he took his cane. But he left a walking stick behind, with all these little notches cut into it. He was keeping track of something, for sure.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Memory Audio
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Excavator Cog, Third Age, circa 2939"},{"descriptiong":"\"This cog was spit from one of the great Uruk war machines, perhaps an excavator. As the Uruks push farther and farther into Mordor, they have torn up the land seeking resources to fuel their Dark Lord's massive war effort."},{"descriptiong":"Excavators churn the ground to uncover metal for the forges, clay for the kilns, and any artifacts, weapons, or tools that might be of use.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Here! Found it in Udûn."},{"descriptiong":"What is it?"},{"descriptiong":"They got these machines, see? And they're digging up everything in Udûn. The thing tears the land up, then the slaves pick through everything. Clay and mud go to the kilns. If they find metal, that goes to the forges. Anything they can use they take back. And if they find an old weapon or piece of armor, they hand it off to the Uruk-hai, the big'uns. Maybe to study, maybe to wear, I don't know."},{"descriptiong":"Hm…"},{"descriptiong":"They're on the move for sure."},{"descriptiong":"We must know what is happening in Mordor. We have other eyes there, but yours are sharp. You serve us well."},{"descriptiong":"You will return there and report back. The council must not learn of your actions. Do not get caught.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Memory Audio
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Cook's knife, Third Age, circa 2940"},{"descriptiong":"This Sigil (Knife) has seen much use. Originally it served an important ceremonial function in preparing ritual feasts. However since the invasion of Núrn by the Uruks every blade that can be turned into a weapon has been used by the Tribesmen in their resistance. The owner of this knife held it defiantly until the end."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Here, take this.  I want someone watching over Queen Marwen at all times. I am afraid she may do harm to herself. Now go."},{"descriptiong":"Mother, what is happening to you? Is this gift worth the price you are paying?"},{"descriptiong":"The end of Darkness is worth whatever price. Such is the spirit of Núrnen, Lithariel."},{"descriptiong":"Núrnen needs you, mother. These visions do not bring us enough benefit to befit your loss."},{"descriptiong":"But they do, my child. I have seen a vision of the Ring-maker, Celebrimbor himself. It is through him alone that Núrnen may be saved.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Mysterious star chart Bone, Late Second Age
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Mysterious star chart Bone, Late Second Age"},{"descriptiong":"Carved from the bone from an unknown animal of immense size, this map of the heavens was no doubt used by a Lore Master of some skill. Only a few select individuals would have been able to use this chart to track the course of the stars in the skies, using complex and, possibly, arcane computations to predict the future."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"…By that time we'd grown used to seeing them, but the shorter one had grown cold, distant. He could read the leaves, the lines in a man's hand, the bumps on his head. He could see, you know? And I guess it got to him. The knowing."},{"descriptiong":"They'd go off together, and you could tell when they met up with the Orcs. The sky would darken and there'd be hail, or rain, or winds that shook the trees. And then, sure enough, everything would clear. They never spoke about any of that, although we'd always want to know. \"\"Best not,\"\" they'd say."},{"descriptiong":"The two left without saying a word. Only it was funny, like, because the shorter fellow left behind all his maps and the odd little board he used to see into the future. Traveling light, maybe, or maybe… I don't know, maybe he thought he'd have no more use for it.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: This parchment contains a note, but its author and intended recipient remain, ultimately, unrevealed. Is this a dispatch of some kind? A recounting of great deeds? Poetry? The note is coded and its message remains indecipherable.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Coded journal entry #3, Third Age, circa 2941"},{"descriptiong":"This parchment contains a note, but its author and intended recipient remain, ultimately, unrevealed. Is this a dispatch of some kind? A recounting of great deeds? Poetry? The note is coded and its message remains indecipherable."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"The damn flies seem to be following me. I can't hardly go nowhere without them buzzing around."},{"descriptiong":"I was going to scout Thaurband, the slave city. The Orcs got a prison there, and enough people in chains to run the mines and the mills and make the city go. But there it was, one stinking fly. I could hear it buzzing, but couldn't see it or squash it."},{"descriptiong":"Thing was following me, I swear. I was out on a skiff, middle of the Sea of Núrnen and the fly was coming along for the ride. Like it knew! Following me, like. All the time: ZZZZZ ZZZZZ."},{"descriptiong":"I can't get the buzzing and humming to stop. It don't matter whether I'm sleeping or eating or squatting. I can hear 'em. They're in my damned head!"},{"descriptiong":"MAKE… 'EM… STOP!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

[{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Excavator Cog, Third Age, circa 2939"},{"descriptiong":"\"This cog was spit from one of the great Uruk war machines, perhaps an excavator. As the Uruks push farther and farther into Mordor, they have torn up the land seeking resources to fuel their Dark Lord's massive war effort."},{"descriptiong":"Excavators churn the ground to uncover metal for the forges, clay for the kilns, and any artifacts, weapons, or tools that might be of use.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Here! Found it in Udûn."},{"descriptiong":"What is it?"},{"descriptiong":"They got these machines, see? And they're digging up everything in Udûn. The thing tears the land up, then the slaves pick through everything. Clay and mud go to the kilns. If they find metal, that goes to the forges. Anything they can use they take back. And if they find an old weapon or piece of armor, they hand it off to the Uruk-hai, the big'uns. Maybe to study, maybe to wear, I don't know."},{"descriptiong":"Hm…"},{"descriptiong":"They're on the move for sure."},{"descriptiong":"We must know what is happening in Mordor. We have other eyes there, but yours are sharp. You serve us well."},{"descriptiong":"You will return there and report back. The council must not learn of your actions. Do not get caught.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Sort of like your mother.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Strange Rock (volcanic) Second Age, circa 1600"},{"descriptiong":"\"Orodruin's eruptions are sudden and violent. When the mountain awakes in fire, none are safe. The skies darken with smoke and ash, and fiery rocks are shot high into the air before landing with deadly force."},{"descriptiong":"This glassy, obsidian stone is one of those volcanic rocks; it dates back to the Second Age, perhaps to when the Dark Lord formed his initial bond with the volcano. These remnants of Orodruin's fury are prized for their hardness. They are often sharpened to make weapons.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Where'd you get off to, child?"},{"descriptiong":"I found this, daddy."},{"descriptiong":"This kind of rock is very rare. It comes from the volcano. There!"},{"descriptiong":"Now, Doom is a foul place, angry and mean. It will explode when Sauron is near and plotting, spitting all manner of foulness into the air: smoke and dust and rocks that burn the ground. It does this as a warning: I will not stay silent for long!"},{"descriptiong":"Sort of like your mother."},{"descriptiong":"Don't tell your mother I said that."},{"descriptiong":"So this rock is…"},{"descriptiong":"It is a rock, nothing more. And you needn't be afraid of a rock. Or Doom, which is silent to this very day."},{"descriptiong":"And, sweetie, if you need a lesson from all this, why, here's a fine one: Even a foul place like that volcano can produce beautiful things.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: I can still fight.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Wooden Handle, formerly part of a mushroom basket, Third Age, circa 2930"},{"descriptiong":"\"This utterly unremarkable basket has seen better days."},{"descriptiong":"Few, if any, of the Outcasts' possessions have survived. In bygone days, this basket would likely have been carried by a woman on her daily errands, and used to carry all manner of goods.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Stop! Do not move. By order of Gondor, trespassing on the Morannon is punishable by death!"},{"descriptiong":"Do not - a woman? The Outcasts now send women alone to steal from us."},{"descriptiong":"Do your worst, Ranger. But I will fight."},{"descriptiong":"You are but skin and bones…"},{"descriptiong":"I can still fight."},{"descriptiong":"Gather what you can and run. Quickly, before the others see you. You shouldn't be let to starve. Quickly, now. Go, go!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: In-Game Description
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Tarnished Ranger's Cloak Clasp, Second Age, circa 3440"},{"descriptiong":"\"These decorative metal bands were used by Rangers primarily to keep their cloaks closed. As guardsmen of Gondor, Rangers were held to exacting standards by their masters, and this meant keeping their clasps polished."},{"descriptiong":"Rangers would use the clasps as makeshift signal devices, catching sunlight to create reflective flashes to communicate with their comrades over long distances.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"The towers will be up soon. Don't know why we're calling them the teeth. They should be called the jaw."},{"descriptiong":"Because they'll be hitting us there?"},{"descriptiong":"Indeed. Right on the jaw, and as often as they can."},{"descriptiong":"That's a grim outlook, brother. We'll be able to see into Mordor here. And bite if necessary.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Gardening Hoe Blade, Third Age, circa 2920
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Gardening Hoe Blade, Third Age, circa 2920"},{"descriptiong":"\"Númenóreans carried a great many things with them in their great diaspora. Their journey was long and perilous, and not all who undertook it lived to see their new homes."},{"descriptiong":"They carried with them what they could; beyond their physical possessions, the tools and the trinkets, they also carried with them their shared dreams for a better life. Their land was consumed, but they would live on. And their relics are spread throughout Middle-earth.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"The first line in the actoul audio without reading meant to say \"He's in jail for a reason\"\n\"He's in gaol for a reason."},{"descriptiong":"For saying what we're all thinking?"},{"descriptiong":"You want to live forever? Plowing this field?"},{"descriptiong":"The Elves lord it over us! Don't they just? Sauron's right. We can live without pain, without growing old."},{"descriptiong":"And you want to go to war to make that happen?"},{"descriptiong":"I want the king to listen to good ideas!"},{"descriptiong":"Well, then, he should have nothing to do with Sauron. Fighting with the Elves is not a bad idea. It's the worst idea imaginable.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

And then, sure enough, everything would clear. They never spoke about any of that, although we'd always want to know. ""Best not,"" they'd say.
