column5: The pleasant smell of Pipeweed emanates from this oversized pouch. The owner of this pouch harvested both the leaves and flowers of the Pipeweed plant in equal measure; the leaves are commonly dried and smoked in pipes and the flowers chewed to create a potent narcotic. As for the pouch itself, it appears to have come from the poison sac of an Ungol.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Pipeweed Pouch, Spider's Venom Sac, Third Age, Circa 2941"},{"descriptiong":"The pleasant smell of Pipeweed emanates from this oversized pouch. The owner of this pouch harvested both the leaves and flowers of the Pipeweed plant in equal measure; the leaves are commonly dried and smoked in pipes and the flowers chewed to create a potent narcotic. As for the pouch itself, it appears to have come from the poison sac of an Ungol."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Careful with the pouch, Torvin! It almost went in the fire."},{"descriptiong":"Bah, that old thing. Time to get rid of that rag. Barely keeps the Pipeweed dry."},{"descriptiong":"It is a rag, brother… and I'll keep this souvenir from our first hunt till it turns to dust. Remember us tracking that Great Spider through Mirkwood nearly sixty years ago - then drawing her out using live bait."},{"descriptiong":"Yes, but, why do I always have to be the bait?"},{"descriptiong":"You have a quality. You make things want to kill you. It's a gift really."},{"descriptiong":"But Torvin, this was your first kill. Ours together. It's what made you a hunter. And I'll treasure it always, brother!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: FEE-AH-NOR… Fëanor. Why must you put me through this, Hirgon?
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Ranger's Reading Primer, Third Age, circa 2915"},{"descriptiong":"The Rangers of Gondor are not just powerful warriors, they also perform a host of duties throughout the Kingdom. Depending on the circumstances, a Ranger may be called upon to serve as a mediator, a judge, a medic and, on occasion, even a teacher."},{"descriptiong":"Rangers have been known to carry basic Reading Primers and, during their stays in villages where opportunities for learning are scant, to select a few favored pupils and show them how to read and write."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"The memory point attached to the primer is of its original owner, Hirgon, teaching his Outcast lover, Eryn, to read:"},{"descriptiong":"Sound it out now…"},{"descriptiong":"FEE-AH-NOR… Fëanor. Why must you put me through this, Hirgon?"},{"descriptiong":"There's no one to blame but yourself. You begged me to teach you the words in my books."},{"descriptiong":"I regret that now. What use is the page here in Mordor?"},{"descriptiong":"Here. Look at this. A note for you."},{"descriptiong":"My love. Be… my… knife…"},{"descriptiong":"Try again."},{"descriptiong":"…Life?"},{"descriptiong":"Or wife."},{"descriptiong":"Wife? Yes, Hirgon. I am yours."},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Pipeweed Pouch, Spider's Venom Sac, Third Age, Circa 2941
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Pipeweed Pouch, Spider's Venom Sac, Third Age, Circa 2941"},{"descriptiong":"The pleasant smell of Pipeweed emanates from this oversized pouch. The owner of this pouch harvested both the leaves and flowers of the Pipeweed plant in equal measure; the leaves are commonly dried and smoked in pipes and the flowers chewed to create a potent narcotic. As for the pouch itself, it appears to have come from the poison sac of an Ungol."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Careful with the pouch, Torvin! It almost went in the fire."},{"descriptiong":"Bah, that old thing. Time to get rid of that rag. Barely keeps the Pipeweed dry."},{"descriptiong":"It is a rag, brother… and I'll keep this souvenir from our first hunt till it turns to dust. Remember us tracking that Great Spider through Mirkwood nearly sixty years ago - then drawing her out using live bait."},{"descriptiong":"Yes, but, why do I always have to be the bait?"},{"descriptiong":"You have a quality. You make things want to kill you. It's a gift really."},{"descriptiong":"But Torvin, this was your first kill. Ours together. It's what made you a hunter. And I'll treasure it always, brother!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "Númenóreans carried a great many things with them in their great diaspora. Their journey was long and perilous, and not all who undertook it lived to see their new homes.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Gardening Hoe Blade, Third Age, circa 2920"},{"descriptiong":"\"Númenóreans carried a great many things with them in their great diaspora. Their journey was long and perilous, and not all who undertook it lived to see their new homes."},{"descriptiong":"They carried with them what they could; beyond their physical possessions, the tools and the trinkets, they also carried with them their shared dreams for a better life. Their land was consumed, but they would live on. And their relics are spread throughout Middle-earth.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"The first line in the actoul audio without reading meant to say \"He's in jail for a reason\"\n\"He's in gaol for a reason."},{"descriptiong":"For saying what we're all thinking?"},{"descriptiong":"You want to live forever? Plowing this field?"},{"descriptiong":"The Elves lord it over us! Don't they just? Sauron's right. We can live without pain, without growing old."},{"descriptiong":"And you want to go to war to make that happen?"},{"descriptiong":"I want the king to listen to good ideas!"},{"descriptiong":"Well, then, he should have nothing to do with Sauron. Fighting with the Elves is not a bad idea. It's the worst idea imaginable.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: 'Dagger' may be a generous application of the word. This is a crude shank and it will never be used for anything but skullduggery.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Orcish dagger, Third Age, circa 1650"},{"descriptiong":"'Dagger' may be a generous application of the word. This is a crude shank and it will never be used for anything but skullduggery."},{"descriptiong":"Uruks generally carry blades of this ilk when engaging in their misdeeds, and the blades are often coated with crude poisons to ensure a victim's painful death. Uruks will often carry daggers like this one into combat, but only employ them as a last resort."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"You've been recalled?"},{"descriptiong":"Aye. To Osgiliath. They're burning the bodies there."},{"descriptiong":"Ehh, it's that bad?"},{"descriptiong":"It's worse. We've abandoned Durthang, either to the Orcs or the Outcasts. I can't imagine which is worse. And we're thin on the ground here."},{"descriptiong":"Two regiments' worth called back home. Maybe a dozen more down with the sweats."},{"descriptiong":"Maybe even more than that. And I don't think we can hide it anymore, no matter how they change up the patrols. The Orcs may have already smelled it out, too. They're getting uppity in Mordor. Here… Look at this."},{"descriptiong":"Ahh… that's quite a blade. Where'd you get it?"},{"descriptiong":"Off an Orc scout. I expect he won't need it anymore. You keep it.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Wonder if they're working for Shelob? Sauron used to feed her, and I guess she don't remember whose pet she is. It might be time for a reminder."
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Torn Banner, Third Age, circa 2940"},{"descriptiong":"Ungol have set upon and partially consumed this crimson banner representing the Dark Lord Sauron. This is not merely a symbolic act; the oversized children of Shelob are organizing against the Uruks, forming raiding parties to bring down what they consider to be invaders into their lands. Whatever truce may have existed between the factions has now ended."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Damn. They got the whole raiding party. And et the flag."},{"descriptiong":"See the webs? It's Spiders. Filthy creatures. Likely coming up from the valley down south."},{"descriptiong":"We should clear it out."},{"descriptiong":"You should shut your big yap. Don't nobody come back from that place."},{"descriptiong":"Wonder if they're working for Shelob? Sauron used to feed her, and I guess she don't remember whose pet she is. It might be time for a reminder.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "This horn heralded the great victory at the end of the Second Age by the Last Alliance at the Battle of Dagorlad. It blew in defiance of the Mouth of Sauron; an assembled army of more than three hundred thousand Orcs; and the Dark Lord himself who ruled over the forces aligned against the Men and Elves.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Rusted Horn, Human, Battle of Dagorlad, Second Age, circa 3430"},{"descriptiong":"\"This horn heralded the great victory at the end of the Second Age by the Last Alliance at the Battle of Dagorlad. It blew in defiance of the Mouth of Sauron; an assembled army of more than three hundred thousand Orcs; and the Dark Lord himself who ruled over the forces aligned against the Men and Elves."},{"descriptiong":"It sounded the charge on the battle plain and serenaded the fallen dead, those unfortunate souls who would be forever doomed to haunt the Dead Marshes.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"They say the enemy is weak on the left, and that the Dwarves will tear through them there. Maybe then we can leave these filthy marshes and go home."},{"descriptiong":"Yesterday, the enemy made a call for parley. We saw the emissary's party ride out, a terrible black figure atop a black horse and flanked by two huge men similarly clad in black. They were not allowed to ride among our lines amid suspicion they would scout our disposition and report back to their vile master. Instead, a small group of Elves and Men rode out to meet him. We could not hear what was said, but… there will be no peace."},{"descriptiong":"Around the camp there are whispers. They say the emissary's mouth blackened and burned with Sauron's words and that saying them caused the emissary great pain. He promised only slavery and toil - and I am compelled to believe it. I cannot help but think we will never make it into Mordor. Only death awaits us here.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: If you don't want it…
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Coin, Gondor, Third Age, circa 2920"},{"descriptiong":"Merchants across Middle-earth know if it's Gondorian, it's good. And they freely accept these silver pieces (known as Castar) as currency, trading them across the civilized realms and with almost all the races of Middle-earth. This particular coin likely made its way into Mordor through that realm's primary trade route, the Sea of Núrnen."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"It's good. Coin of the realm."},{"descriptiong":"Sure, but it's the coin of Gondor's realm."},{"descriptiong":"If you don't want it…"},{"descriptiong":"I didn't say that, Cap'n. But how about a few less of these and a little more of that Elvish cloth you brought over from Eregion?"},{"descriptiong":"I think we can do that.\""},{"descriptiong":""},{"descriptiong":"(Celebrimbor's Commentary)"},{"descriptiong":"\"Wealth will not save Gondor. Uruks do not care for trinkets."},{"descriptiong":"Sauron will use gold to buy allies among the kingdoms of Men.\""},{"descriptiong":""},{"descriptiong":""}]

[{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Apothecary Jar, Third Age, circa 1940"},{"descriptiong":"\"This jar once held the elixir which sustains and corrupts the Queen of the Shore. When Marwen awoke screaming from nightmares showing her the Tower of Sauron approaching Núrn she sought wisdom. She traveled to the Grey Mountains seeking answers."},{"descriptiong":"When she returned she brought the elixir with her, and under its influence she spent many hours staring into the sacred flame. In it she heard a calming voice and found hope for her people, if not for herself.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"The North collapses upon us. A Tower of nightmare builds in Núrnen. The Nameless One returns."},{"descriptiong":"Mother, take this."},{"descriptiong":"Thank you, my child."},{"descriptiong":"These visions corrode you.  And what medicine we still have is fast done away."},{"descriptiong":"My visions are the hope of Núrnen.  If I must sacrifice myself for my people, so be it."},{"descriptiong":"What happened in the Grey Mountains, mother?"},{"descriptiong":"What happened, Lithariel?  I left with the strength we need.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Memory Audio
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Rusted Horn, Human, Battle of Dagorlad, Second Age, circa 3430"},{"descriptiong":"\"This horn heralded the great victory at the end of the Second Age by the Last Alliance at the Battle of Dagorlad. It blew in defiance of the Mouth of Sauron; an assembled army of more than three hundred thousand Orcs; and the Dark Lord himself who ruled over the forces aligned against the Men and Elves."},{"descriptiong":"It sounded the charge on the battle plain and serenaded the fallen dead, those unfortunate souls who would be forever doomed to haunt the Dead Marshes.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"They say the enemy is weak on the left, and that the Dwarves will tear through them there. Maybe then we can leave these filthy marshes and go home."},{"descriptiong":"Yesterday, the enemy made a call for parley. We saw the emissary's party ride out, a terrible black figure atop a black horse and flanked by two huge men similarly clad in black. They were not allowed to ride among our lines amid suspicion they would scout our disposition and report back to their vile master. Instead, a small group of Elves and Men rode out to meet him. We could not hear what was said, but… there will be no peace."},{"descriptiong":"Around the camp there are whispers. They say the emissary's mouth blackened and burned with Sauron's words and that saying them caused the emissary great pain. He promised only slavery and toil - and I am compelled to believe it. I cannot help but think we will never make it into Mordor. Only death awaits us here.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Graven idol representing Morgoth, Second Age, circa 3318
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Graven idol representing Morgoth, Second Age, circa 3318"},{"descriptiong":"\"Before Númenor's fall, its priests and dark acolytes held sacrifices to strange gods in the temples, and graven idols such as these were freely worshipped."},{"descriptiong":"This idol represents Morgoth, the first Dark Lord of Middle-earth, and was likely carried to the mainland by missionaries seeking to spread his vile message.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Pharazon!"},{"descriptiong":"He's been sold a bill of goods, all right! And what do we get? More war! More taxes! Ha! Human sacrifice in the town square! You can hear the screams, all day and all night, and we're made to worship this, this hideous thing. The great tree, kindling! The king's ears filled with rubbish from his…"},{"descriptiong":"…his advisor, the great chained wonder, Sauron, now princely Sauron."},{"descriptiong":"Eilindel is right! Númenor is ruined, and the boats can't take us away from this charnel house fast enough!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: I will avenge you, brother. I will hunt this Graug in your name. And I will be the hunter you always wanted me to be."
column7: [{"descriptiong":"Dwarven-made and built to withstand great amounts of punishment, this wood-and-steel buckler served its user well. Many marks and scorings hint to its usefulness in combat, but the blood stains are perhaps an indication of a grim outcome for the Dwarf who carried it into battle."},{"descriptiong":"It is believed by some to belong to Torvin, who's brother was killed by a graug who he swore to hunt, much like the person speaking in the memory of this shield."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Brother…? Brother, where are you…?"},{"descriptiong":"The bloody Graug knocked me senseless… and… brother… By Durin's beard, no. No, no, this shouldn't be…"},{"descriptiong":"This is my fault. I should've been more prepared… I should've listened to you… I should've been a better hunter."},{"descriptiong":"I will avenge you, brother. I will hunt this Graug in your name. And I will be the hunter you always wanted me to be.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "Are you Athelas or Hithlas? Why can't I find anything in this almanac? Well… only one way to be sure. Cheers. *swallows* And now I wait. This'll either cure my fever or I'll be dead in seconds.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Musty Tome, Third Age, circa 2890\n\"This almanac has been bound in leather and appears to be more than a century old. The writing within is a compilation of history, poetry and translation from across Middle-earth. It gathers together works of antiquity from the Great Realms of Gondor, Arnor and Númenor and even some samples of songs from the distant Halflings."},{"descriptiong":"The most curious entry is the \"Lament\", a work of metered verse whose controversial origin has been debated among scholars for many years; it has been suggested by some that its author was an Ent, one of the ancient Shepherds of the Trees.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Are you Athelas or Hithlas? Why can't I find anything in this almanac? Well… only one way to be sure. Cheers. *swallows* And now I wait. This'll either cure my fever or I'll be dead in seconds."},{"descriptiong":"It shan't do either. You'll need to ground it up for its healing properties."},{"descriptiong":"You… the Outcast woman…"},{"descriptiong":"I'm Eryn. I never got to thank you, Ranger. There are but few of your kind on the Black Gate."},{"descriptiong":"Duty clouds kindness in these parts. It's why I deserted. I'm Hirgon.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Mortar and pestle, possibly of Númenórean Origin, Second Age, circa 3261.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Mortar and pestle, possibly of Númenórean Origin, Second Age, circa 3261."},{"descriptiong":"A remarkable find, this artifact may date back to the Second Age, to the great Númenórean incursion wherein the Dark Lord Sauron willingly fell into captivity. It would likely have been used by a healer to grind roots and herbs in the creation of poultices and unguents required to keep an army hale and (relatively) healthy."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"The first messengers have rolled in to camp. They're reporting few casualties. We've struck a mighty blow against the forces of Mordor aligned against us."},{"descriptiong":"Let it be so, and not fools' idle chatter. Hegadorn! What news?"},{"descriptiong":"Haha! They say we have won a monumental victory! You'll not be needing all that Athelas you've been grinding, my friend. Few need healing on this day! And more's the wonder! They say the Golden King has brought back a prize - Sauron himself, wearing the heavy chains!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "Keep sharpening! You've got to hone yer axe until its edge can split one of yer beard hairs in two.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Whetstone, Third Age"},{"descriptiong":"Among the millions of volcanic rocks to be found within the mountainous borders of Mordor, this stone is unique. It is a Dwarven Whetstone, used to sharpen axes, knives and swords to a keen edge that will cut through even the toughest Uruk armor or the stony skin of a Troll."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"'It's the keen edge what cuts the mountain,' as the saying goes. Whoever the stone's user was, he was most thorough in his efforts."},{"descriptiong":"\"Keep sharpening! You've got to hone yer axe until its edge can split one of yer beard hairs in two."},{"descriptiong":"Aw, it's sharp enough to kill a Graug. Now, pass me the pipe…"},{"descriptiong":"'Sharp enough' ain't what the hunt's about, little brother! You've got to learn to respect the hunt. A keen blade for a clean kill. Without respect for the beast, we're no better than the Orcs. Now, let's give 'er a test…"},{"descriptiong":"Fer Durin, give a Dwarf fair warning when ya yank hairs from his beard!"},{"descriptiong":"Look, at this, Torvin! Split the hair in two! There's hope for you yet!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Here. Look at this. A note for you.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Ranger's Reading Primer, Third Age, circa 2915"},{"descriptiong":"The Rangers of Gondor are not just powerful warriors, they also perform a host of duties throughout the Kingdom. Depending on the circumstances, a Ranger may be called upon to serve as a mediator, a judge, a medic and, on occasion, even a teacher."},{"descriptiong":"Rangers have been known to carry basic Reading Primers and, during their stays in villages where opportunities for learning are scant, to select a few favored pupils and show them how to read and write."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"The memory point attached to the primer is of its original owner, Hirgon, teaching his Outcast lover, Eryn, to read:"},{"descriptiong":"Sound it out now…"},{"descriptiong":"FEE-AH-NOR… Fëanor. Why must you put me through this, Hirgon?"},{"descriptiong":"There's no one to blame but yourself. You begged me to teach you the words in my books."},{"descriptiong":"I regret that now. What use is the page here in Mordor?"},{"descriptiong":"Here. Look at this. A note for you."},{"descriptiong":"My love. Be… my… knife…"},{"descriptiong":"Try again."},{"descriptiong":"…Life?"},{"descriptiong":"Or wife."},{"descriptiong":"Wife? Yes, Hirgon. I am yours."},{"descriptiong":""}]

column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Coin, Gondor, Third Age, circa 2920"},{"descriptiong":"Merchants across Middle-earth know if it's Gondorian, it's good. This particular coin likely made its way into Mordor through that realm's primary trade route, the Sea of Núrnen."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"It's good. Coin of the realm."},{"descriptiong":"Sure, but it's the coin of Gondor's realm."},{"descriptiong":"If you don't want it…"},{"descriptiong":"I didn't say that, Cap'n. But how about a few less of these and a little more of that Elvish cloth you brought over from Eregion?"},{"descriptiong":"I think we can do that.\""},{"descriptiong":""},{"descriptiong":"(Celebrimbor's Commentary)"},{"descriptiong":"\"Wealth will not save Gondor. Uruks do not care for trinkets."},{"descriptiong":"Sauron will use gold to buy allies among the kingdoms of Men.\""},{"descriptiong":""},{"descriptiong":""}]

And what do we get? More war! More taxes! Ha! Human sacrifice in the town square! You can hear the screams, all day and all night, and we're made to worship this, this hideous thing. The great tree, kindling! The king's ears filled with rubbish from his…"},{"descriptiong":"…his advisor, the great chained wonder, Sauron, now princely Sauron."},{"descriptiong":"Eilindel is right! Númenor is ruined, and the boats can't take us away from this charnel house fast enough!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Now, Doom is a foul place, angry and mean. It will explode when Sauron is near and plotting, spitting all manner of foulness into the air: smoke and dust and rocks that burn the ground. It does this as a warning: I will not stay silent for long!
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Strange Rock (volcanic) Second Age, circa 1600"},{"descriptiong":"\"Orodruin's eruptions are sudden and violent. When the mountain awakes in fire, none are safe. The skies darken with smoke and ash, and fiery rocks are shot high into the air before landing with deadly force."},{"descriptiong":"This glassy, obsidian stone is one of those volcanic rocks; it dates back to the Second Age, perhaps to when the Dark Lord formed his initial bond with the volcano. These remnants of Orodruin's fury are prized for their hardness. They are often sharpened to make weapons.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Where'd you get off to, child?"},{"descriptiong":"I found this, daddy."},{"descriptiong":"This kind of rock is very rare. It comes from the volcano. There!"},{"descriptiong":"Now, Doom is a foul place, angry and mean. It will explode when Sauron is near and plotting, spitting all manner of foulness into the air: smoke and dust and rocks that burn the ground. It does this as a warning: I will not stay silent for long!"},{"descriptiong":"Sort of like your mother."},{"descriptiong":"Don't tell your mother I said that."},{"descriptiong":"So this rock is…"},{"descriptiong":"It is a rock, nothing more. And you needn't be afraid of a rock. Or Doom, which is silent to this very day."},{"descriptiong":"And, sweetie, if you need a lesson from all this, why, here's a fine one: Even a foul place like that volcano can produce beautiful things.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "Not Old Scorchy!" is a common refrain among the Orcs of Udûn. It is interesting to note that while branding with red-hot irons as punishment is commonplace, with the Orcs searing the flesh of their unruly brethren as much as they do their slaves, Old Scorchy is unique, used only on the most recalcitrant.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Branding Iron, Orcish, Third Age, 2942"},{"descriptiong":"\"Not Old Scorchy!\" is a common refrain among the Orcs of Udûn. It is interesting to note that while branding with red-hot irons as punishment is commonplace, with the Orcs searing the flesh of their unruly brethren as much as they do their slaves, Old Scorchy is unique, used only on the most recalcitrant."},{"descriptiong":"The Orcs believe Scorchy holds sorcerous powers enabling it to burn longer and hotter, and to scorch with such intensity the pain can be felt for weeks after the branding.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"All right, you. You're not so brave now, are you? Hold 'em, boys."},{"descriptiong":"Get your filthy hands off me!"},{"descriptiong":"It's simple, see? Do unto others quicker and harder than they'd do unto you. But at least you tried. Next time, try harder. This is going to hurt. A lot. But you'll learn who's in charge."},{"descriptiong":"No! Not… not Old Scorchy! Anything but Old Scorchy!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

It would likely have been used by a healer to grind roots and herbs in the creation of poultices and unguents required to keep an army hale and (relatively) healthy."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"The first messengers have rolled in to camp. They're reporting few casualties. We've struck a mighty blow against the forces of Mordor aligned against us."},{"descriptiong":"Let it be so, and not fools' idle chatter. Hegadorn! What news?"},{"descriptiong":"Haha! They say we have won a monumental victory! You'll not be needing all that Athelas you've been grinding, my friend. Few need healing on this day! And more's the wonder! They say the Golden King has brought back a prize - Sauron himself, wearing the heavy chains!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Memory Audio
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Strange Rock (volcanic) Second Age, circa 1600"},{"descriptiong":"\"Orodruin's eruptions are sudden and violent. When the mountain awakes in fire, none are safe. The skies darken with smoke and ash, and fiery rocks are shot high into the air before landing with deadly force."},{"descriptiong":"This glassy, obsidian stone is one of those volcanic rocks; it dates back to the Second Age, perhaps to when the Dark Lord formed his initial bond with the volcano. These remnants of Orodruin's fury are prized for their hardness. They are often sharpened to make weapons.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Where'd you get off to, child?"},{"descriptiong":"I found this, daddy."},{"descriptiong":"This kind of rock is very rare. It comes from the volcano. There!"},{"descriptiong":"Now, Doom is a foul place, angry and mean. It will explode when Sauron is near and plotting, spitting all manner of foulness into the air: smoke and dust and rocks that burn the ground. It does this as a warning: I will not stay silent for long!"},{"descriptiong":"Sort of like your mother."},{"descriptiong":"Don't tell your mother I said that."},{"descriptiong":"So this rock is…"},{"descriptiong":"It is a rock, nothing more. And you needn't be afraid of a rock. Or Doom, which is silent to this very day."},{"descriptiong":"And, sweetie, if you need a lesson from all this, why, here's a fine one: Even a foul place like that volcano can produce beautiful things.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Around the camp there are whispers. They say the emissary's mouth blackened and burned with Sauron's words and that saying them caused the emissary great pain. He promised only slavery and toil - and I am compelled to believe it. I cannot help but think we will never make it into Mordor. Only death awaits us here."
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Rusted Horn, Human, Battle of Dagorlad, Second Age, circa 3430"},{"descriptiong":"\"This horn heralded the great victory at the end of the Second Age by the Last Alliance at the Battle of Dagorlad. It blew in defiance of the Mouth of Sauron; an assembled army of more than three hundred thousand Orcs; and the Dark Lord himself who ruled over the forces aligned against the Men and Elves."},{"descriptiong":"It sounded the charge on the battle plain and serenaded the fallen dead, those unfortunate souls who would be forever doomed to haunt the Dead Marshes.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"They say the enemy is weak on the left, and that the Dwarves will tear through them there. Maybe then we can leave these filthy marshes and go home."},{"descriptiong":"Yesterday, the enemy made a call for parley. We saw the emissary's party ride out, a terrible black figure atop a black horse and flanked by two huge men similarly clad in black. They were not allowed to ride among our lines amid suspicion they would scout our disposition and report back to their vile master. Instead, a small group of Elves and Men rode out to meet him. We could not hear what was said, but… there will be no peace."},{"descriptiong":"Around the camp there are whispers. They say the emissary's mouth blackened and burned with Sauron's words and that saying them caused the emissary great pain. He promised only slavery and toil - and I am compelled to believe it. I cannot help but think we will never make it into Mordor. Only death awaits us here.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

[{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Unhappy Skull, First Age"},{"descriptiong":"For a thousand years this skull has been a sacred relic of the most feared Orc Assassin cult within Mordor, the Death's Head. They hold it as a symbol of their glorious future free of the scourge of Man."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Please… my wife."},{"descriptiong":"Yes, the Uruk have told me you do go on about her."},{"descriptiong":"Tell us what we need to know. Where are the bandits? Where are your friends?"},{"descriptiong":"I need to see her! I need…"},{"descriptiong":"Yes, your wife. Again. It has been a long time. And while the physical pain of your torture will pass, you will always hurt inside. The loss is like a gaping wound…"},{"descriptiong":"You have suffered quite enough torment, and it is time for your misery to end. Your wife is waiting."},{"descriptiong":"Damn you. They're in the woods. The hidden woods."},{"descriptiong":"Take him away…"},{"descriptiong":"But you said…"},{"descriptiong":"Yes. Our promise. You will be reunited with your wife, now long dead. Know you have betrayed your friends and doomed yourself over a distant memory, a phantom. And when you are reunited with your wife, know that we will also carry your skull as a trifle and a reminder that our will is irresistible. Now, go."},{"descriptiong":"Your wife awaits.\""},{"descriptiong":"Trivia"},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Eilindel is right! Númenor is ruined, and the boats can't take us away from this charnel house fast enough!"
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Graven idol representing Morgoth, Second Age, circa 3318"},{"descriptiong":"\"Before Númenor's fall, its priests and dark acolytes held sacrifices to strange gods in the temples, and graven idols such as these were freely worshipped."},{"descriptiong":"This idol represents Morgoth, the first Dark Lord of Middle-earth, and was likely carried to the mainland by missionaries seeking to spread his vile message.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Pharazon!"},{"descriptiong":"He's been sold a bill of goods, all right! And what do we get? More war! More taxes! Ha! Human sacrifice in the town square! You can hear the screams, all day and all night, and we're made to worship this, this hideous thing. The great tree, kindling! The king's ears filled with rubbish from his…"},{"descriptiong":"…his advisor, the great chained wonder, Sauron, now princely Sauron."},{"descriptiong":"Eilindel is right! Númenor is ruined, and the boats can't take us away from this charnel house fast enough!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: How is it confused? I see the prisoners escaping, running towards the gates, which seem to have flown open by sorcery or sabotage.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Lockpick, Second Age"},{"descriptiong":"This simple metal prod is a burglar's best friend. The pick is small and easily concealed; it can be palmed or even hidden under the tongue with minimal effort. In the hands of a skilled thief, the pick can be used to quickly and quietly defeat most locks of non-magical origin."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Sir, the situation is very confused…"},{"descriptiong":"How is it confused? I see the prisoners escaping, running towards the gates, which seem to have flown open by sorcery or sabotage."},{"descriptiong":"Archers, stand down!"},{"descriptiong":"Sir?"},{"descriptiong":"We're not wasting good arrows on those people. They've served their purpose: They're damned, they're damned well out of my hair. Mordor can take the whole stinking lot of them."},{"descriptiong":"And send my compliments to the captain of the gates. I suppose he sent me this lockpick as some sort of joke.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "Pharazon!
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Graven idol representing Morgoth, Second Age, circa 3318"},{"descriptiong":"\"Before Númenor's fall, its priests and dark acolytes held sacrifices to strange gods in the temples, and graven idols such as these were freely worshipped."},{"descriptiong":"This idol represents Morgoth, the first Dark Lord of Middle-earth, and was likely carried to the mainland by missionaries seeking to spread his vile message.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Pharazon!"},{"descriptiong":"He's been sold a bill of goods, all right! And what do we get? More war! More taxes! Ha! Human sacrifice in the town square! You can hear the screams, all day and all night, and we're made to worship this, this hideous thing. The great tree, kindling! The king's ears filled with rubbish from his…"},{"descriptiong":"…his advisor, the great chained wonder, Sauron, now princely Sauron."},{"descriptiong":"Eilindel is right! Númenor is ruined, and the boats can't take us away from this charnel house fast enough!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column3: Medallion Half 1, The Two Trees of Valinor
column5: Aaaaaaggggh!
column6: Medallion Half 1, The Two Trees of Valinor
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Shattered Medallion Half, The Two Trees of Valinor, Second Age, circa 3430"},{"descriptiong":"Across Mordor the Two Trees of Valinor are recognized as a symbol of the light of creation and of the ancient bond between Elves and Men. This medallion half, crafted by the Elves, commemorates the original two trees of legend, whose scions now survive only in the White Tree of Gondor."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"All right… hold still. I'm afraid to say, it's going to…"},{"descriptiong":"Aaaaaaggggh!"},{"descriptiong":"…it's going to hurt."},{"descriptiong":"I've done all I can. We've called for one of your people, but I don't… in the meantime, why don't you tell me about that? The medallion you're holding…"},{"descriptiong":"You just want to distract me. Very well. These are the Two Trees of Valinor… a symbol of the endless cycle: Life, death, and rebirth. Come closer, and I will tell you their tale. We must…"},{"descriptiong":"…I fear we must distract ourselves from the grim happenings of this day.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: In-Game Description
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Horned Helmet, Third Age, circa 2920"},{"descriptiong":"\"This helmet was once used by the Outcasts of Udûn for secret rituals. The horns and the leather were taken from the wild kine of Araw, hunted far from Mordor in the fields of Rhûn. It dates from a distant time when these men were prisoners of Gondor, made to toil on the construction of the Towers of the Teeth."},{"descriptiong":"Even now, the Outcasts remain mistrustful of those wearing metal armor. This helmet is a reminder of dark times past, a harbinger of darker times to come and a symbol of the Outcasts determination to never again live under the yoke of slavery.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"You've let me into your homes, you've let me into your lives, and now you bestow upon me your greatest honor."},{"descriptiong":"Though I come from The Black Gate, though I was once known to you as the enemy, I turn my back on Gondor. You people, you Outcasts, as you've been named, are people of honor, people of strength. I have found love within your tribe, but for your tribe as well. And you have taught me of a life I thirsted for, but never knew existed."},{"descriptiong":"Now it is my time to teach you. I will impart to you all my knowledge of war. The Orcs push us, but we will find strength and push back. And this land will be ours!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: You should shut your big yap. Don't nobody come back from that place.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Torn Banner, Third Age, circa 2940"},{"descriptiong":"Ungol have set upon and partially consumed this crimson banner representing the Dark Lord Sauron. This is not merely a symbolic act; the oversized children of Shelob are organizing against the Uruks, forming raiding parties to bring down what they consider to be invaders into their lands. Whatever truce may have existed between the factions has now ended."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Damn. They got the whole raiding party. And et the flag."},{"descriptiong":"See the webs? It's Spiders. Filthy creatures. Likely coming up from the valley down south."},{"descriptiong":"We should clear it out."},{"descriptiong":"You should shut your big yap. Don't nobody come back from that place."},{"descriptiong":"Wonder if they're working for Shelob? Sauron used to feed her, and I guess she don't remember whose pet she is. It might be time for a reminder.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "This helmet was once used by the Outcasts of Udûn for secret rituals. The horns and the leather were taken from the wild kine of Araw, hunted far from Mordor in the fields of Rhûn. It dates from a distant time when these men were prisoners of Gondor, made to toil on the construction of the Towers of the Teeth.

The Orcs push us, but we will find strength and push back. And this land will be ours!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

[{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Herald's parchment, Third Age, 2941"},{"descriptiong":"\"Bad news has wings,\" the saying goes. So it was with the dispatches from Erebor, heralding the Orcs' great defeat at the Battle of the Five Armies. This particular scroll made its way into Mordor carried by a messenger whose ill tidings were received less than warmly by his comrades. Though the courier's identity was never revealed, he was referred to by the Uruks, with great affection, as 'dinner.'"},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"It's never good news.\nNaw, and I saw to it he didn't…"},{"descriptiong":"All right, you stinking lot. Shut your gobs."},{"descriptiong":"SHUT IT!"},{"descriptiong":"Got some terrible news, here. Terrible. Once again the filthy Humans sided with the Dwarves who had help from those sanctimonious bastards the Elves who were rescued by - and I am not making this up - the damned giant Eagles to slaughter thousands of our brethren in what we should all be calling the battle to unfairly gang up on the Orcs."},{"descriptiong":"Our lands get invaded, our chieftains killed, and our people murdered. Where does it end? Well, I tell you, it ends here. And it ends right now! They can't stop the march of progress. They can't stop us!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: SHUT IT!
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Herald's parchment, Third Age, 2941"},{"descriptiong":"\"Bad news has wings,\" the saying goes. So it was with the dispatches from Erebor, heralding the Orcs' great defeat at the Battle of the Five Armies. This particular scroll made its way into Mordor carried by a messenger whose ill tidings were received less than warmly by his comrades. Though the courier's identity was never revealed, he was referred to by the Uruks, with great affection, as 'dinner.'"},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"It's never good news.\nNaw, and I saw to it he didn't…"},{"descriptiong":"All right, you stinking lot. Shut your gobs."},{"descriptiong":"SHUT IT!"},{"descriptiong":"Got some terrible news, here. Terrible. Once again the filthy Humans sided with the Dwarves who had help from those sanctimonious bastards the Elves who were rescued by - and I am not making this up - the damned giant Eagles to slaughter thousands of our brethren in what we should all be calling the battle to unfairly gang up on the Orcs."},{"descriptiong":"Our lands get invaded, our chieftains killed, and our people murdered. Where does it end? Well, I tell you, it ends here. And it ends right now! They can't stop the march of progress. They can't stop us!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: This key was crafted long ago by the locksmiths of Khazad-Dûm. It is able to open a wide array of locks. It would be of great value to a burglar or spy.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Lockbox Key, Third Age, circa 2930"},{"descriptiong":"This key was crafted long ago by the locksmiths of Khazad-Dûm. It is able to open a wide array of locks. It would be of great value to a burglar or spy."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"The Orcs are making things mighty difficult. This might be my last run in a long while."},{"descriptiong":"My wife and I… we need to… be… elsewhere."},{"descriptiong":"The lockbox. Open it. Now."},{"descriptiong":"Wh-why?"},{"descriptiong":"These are hard times, and I need to know you can pay. Up front."},{"descriptiong":"Well, now. That's hardly enough for both."},{"descriptiong":"We've always… that's all I have! Please, my wife!"},{"descriptiong":"Should've saved more. Now: Room for one on the boat. You decide…\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "This jar once held the elixir which sustains and corrupts the Queen of the Shore. When Marwen awoke screaming from nightmares showing her the Tower of Sauron approaching Núrn she sought wisdom. She traveled to the Grey Mountains seeking answers.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Apothecary Jar, Third Age, circa 1940"},{"descriptiong":"\"This jar once held the elixir which sustains and corrupts the Queen of the Shore. When Marwen awoke screaming from nightmares showing her the Tower of Sauron approaching Núrn she sought wisdom. She traveled to the Grey Mountains seeking answers."},{"descriptiong":"When she returned she brought the elixir with her, and under its influence she spent many hours staring into the sacred flame. In it she heard a calming voice and found hope for her people, if not for herself.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"The North collapses upon us. A Tower of nightmare builds in Núrnen. The Nameless One returns."},{"descriptiong":"Mother, take this."},{"descriptiong":"Thank you, my child."},{"descriptiong":"These visions corrode you.  And what medicine we still have is fast done away."},{"descriptiong":"My visions are the hope of Núrnen.  If I must sacrifice myself for my people, so be it."},{"descriptiong":"What happened in the Grey Mountains, mother?"},{"descriptiong":"What happened, Lithariel?  I left with the strength we need.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "We'll go tonight. No more being bossed around by that damned Uruk-hai. We'll sneak into the barracks and bleed that shrakh dry. He won't be so high and mighty when he's dead. And we'll run the place. You and me. All's for us.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Grog Bowl, Orcish, Third Age, 2942\n\"The myth of the filthy, crud-encrusted Uruk grog bowl is just that. Uruk trainers beat it into their charges to keep their grog bowls as clean as possible to avoid the old soldier's disease."},{"descriptiong":"These bowls are commonly made of clay and baked in huge kilns, but Mordor has proved a fruitful realm for the Uruks, and now some bowls are made of metal or wood.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"We'll go tonight. No more being bossed around by that damned Uruk-hai. We'll sneak into the barracks and bleed that shrakh dry. He won't be so high and mighty when he's dead. And we'll run the place. You and me. All's for us."},{"descriptiong":"Fresh meat? More grog?"},{"descriptiong":"We won't be going hungry, that's a fact.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "All right, worms. Welcome to The Black Gate. You'll be building our watchtowers for us. Hard work will be rewarded.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Iron Shackle, Second Age, circa 3436"},{"descriptiong":"\"These are prisoner's shackles, leg irons to be specific. They date back to the Second Age and were most likely worn by Gondorian captives, men and women whose involuntary servitude built the Towers of the Teeth flanking the Morannon."},{"descriptiong":"These captives would later throw off their shackles and begin a new life as Outcasts in Udûn. Some would keep their shackles to remind themselves of their hardship.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"All right, worms. Welcome to The Black Gate. You'll be building our watchtowers for us. Hard work will be rewarded."},{"descriptiong":"Sir, do you mean hard work will be rewarded with a shorter sentence?"},{"descriptiong":"You're traitors, the lot of you. Murderers and thieves. When I say rewarded, I mean I won't throw you to the Caragors.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: We won't be going hungry, that's a fact."
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Grog Bowl, Orcish, Third Age, 2942\n\"The myth of the filthy, crud-encrusted Uruk grog bowl is just that. Uruk trainers beat it into their charges to keep their grog bowls as clean as possible to avoid the old soldier's disease."},{"descriptiong":"These bowls are commonly made of clay and baked in huge kilns, but Mordor has proved a fruitful realm for the Uruks, and now some bowls are made of metal or wood.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"We'll go tonight. No more being bossed around by that damned Uruk-hai. We'll sneak into the barracks and bleed that shrakh dry. He won't be so high and mighty when he's dead. And we'll run the place. You and me. All's for us."},{"descriptiong":"Fresh meat? More grog?"},{"descriptiong":"We won't be going hungry, that's a fact.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: This ring was given to the unhappy bandit Frolum by his beloved wife as a symbol of their undying love. It was violently pulled from Frolum's hand, along with his index finger after his capture by the Dark Lord Sauron's minions. Sauron would use this ring to torment Frolum into betraying his comrades.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Frolum's Ring, First Age."},{"descriptiong":"This ring was given to the unhappy bandit Frolum by his beloved wife as a symbol of their undying love. It was violently pulled from Frolum's hand, along with his index finger after his capture by the Dark Lord Sauron's minions. Sauron would use this ring to torment Frolum into betraying his comrades."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Who's this now?"},{"descriptiong":"Some unhappy bandit. Name's Frolum or Gorfab or something. He was screaming for his wife. The boys laid into 'im a bit."},{"descriptiong":"More'n a bit. He dead?"},{"descriptiong":"Naw. The boys know the big man's powerful livid and wants a word. This sack of dung might know where his thief pals are hiding."},{"descriptiong":"Strip him down. Take the ring, too, and give it to the boss; he likes that stuff. And when he wakes up…\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Memory Audio
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Tattered Note, Third Age, 2942"},{"descriptiong":"A parchment letter, sent from the Outcast Eryn, details her imminent capture by the Uruks. The note is clearly intended for Hirgon, her husband and leader of the Outcasts. Whether it has reached its intended recipient is another matter entirely."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"My Dear Hirgon:"},{"descriptiong":"I hide outside the camp, and pray they do not find me. They are taking anyone they find into slavery."},{"descriptiong":"If only you were here, but I know you must fight the Uruks or there will be no chance any of us will ever be free."},{"descriptiong":"I fear I will never see you again."},{"descriptiong":"If they find me, I do not know how long I can survive."},{"descriptiong":"Your beloved wife, Eryn\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: You have suffered quite enough torment, and it is time for your misery to end. Your wife is waiting.

They're in the woods. The hidden woods."},{"descriptiong":"Take him away…"},{"descriptiong":"But you said…"},{"descriptiong":"Yes. Our promise. You will be reunited with your wife, now long dead. Know you have betrayed your friends and doomed yourself over a distant memory, a phantom. Now, go."},{"descriptiong":"Your wife awaits.\""},{"descriptiong":"Trivia"},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Try again.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Ranger's Reading Primer, Third Age, circa 2915"},{"descriptiong":"The Rangers of Gondor are not just powerful warriors, they also perform a host of duties throughout the Kingdom. Depending on the circumstances, a Ranger may be called upon to serve as a mediator, a judge, a medic and, on occasion, even a teacher."},{"descriptiong":"Rangers have been known to carry basic Reading Primers and, during their stays in villages where opportunities for learning are scant, to select a few favored pupils and show them how to read and write."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"The memory point attached to the primer is of its original owner, Hirgon, teaching his Outcast lover, Eryn, to read:"},{"descriptiong":"Sound it out now…"},{"descriptiong":"FEE-AH-NOR… Fëanor. Why must you put me through this, Hirgon?"},{"descriptiong":"There's no one to blame but yourself. You begged me to teach you the words in my books."},{"descriptiong":"I regret that now. What use is the page here in Mordor?"},{"descriptiong":"Here. Look at this. A note for you."},{"descriptiong":"My love. Be… my… knife…"},{"descriptiong":"Try again."},{"descriptiong":"…Life?"},{"descriptiong":"Or wife."},{"descriptiong":"Wife? Yes, Hirgon. I am yours."},{"descriptiong":""}]

[{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Coded journal entry #3, Third Age, circa 2941"},{"descriptiong":"This parchment contains a note, but its author and intended recipient remain, ultimately, unrevealed. Is this a dispatch of some kind? A recounting of great deeds? Poetry? The note is coded and its message remains indecipherable."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"The damn flies seem to be following me. I can't hardly go nowhere without them buzzing around."},{"descriptiong":"I was going to scout Thaurband, the slave city. The Orcs got a prison there, and enough people in chains to run the mines and the mills and make the city go. But there it was, one stinking fly. I could hear it buzzing, but couldn't see it or squash it."},{"descriptiong":"Thing was following me, I swear. I was out on a skiff, middle of the Sea of Núrnen and the fly was coming along for the ride. Like it knew! Following me, like. All the time: ZZZZZ ZZZZZ."},{"descriptiong":"I can't get the buzzing and humming to stop. It don't matter whether I'm sleeping or eating or squatting. I can hear 'em. They're in my damned head!"},{"descriptiong":"MAKE… 'EM… STOP!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: I fear I will never see you again.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Tattered Note, Third Age, 2942"},{"descriptiong":"A parchment letter, sent from the Outcast Eryn, details her imminent capture by the Uruks. The note is clearly intended for Hirgon, her husband and leader of the Outcasts. Whether it has reached its intended recipient is another matter entirely."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"My Dear Hirgon:"},{"descriptiong":"I hide outside the camp, and pray they do not find me. They are taking anyone they find into slavery."},{"descriptiong":"If only you were here, but I know you must fight the Uruks or there will be no chance any of us will ever be free."},{"descriptiong":"I fear I will never see you again."},{"descriptiong":"If they find me, I do not know how long I can survive."},{"descriptiong":"Your beloved wife, Eryn\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Mother, what is happening to you? Is this gift worth the price you are paying?
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Cook's knife, Third Age, circa 2940"},{"descriptiong":"This Sigil (Knife) has seen much use. Originally it served an important ceremonial function in preparing ritual feasts. However since the invasion of Núrn by the Uruks every blade that can be turned into a weapon has been used by the Tribesmen in their resistance. The owner of this knife held it defiantly until the end."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Here, take this.  I want someone watching over Queen Marwen at all times. I am afraid she may do harm to herself. Now go."},{"descriptiong":"Mother, what is happening to you? Is this gift worth the price you are paying?"},{"descriptiong":"The end of Darkness is worth whatever price. Such is the spirit of Núrnen, Lithariel."},{"descriptiong":"Núrnen needs you, mother. These visions do not bring us enough benefit to befit your loss."},{"descriptiong":"But they do, my child. I have seen a vision of the Ring-maker, Celebrimbor himself. It is through him alone that Núrnen may be saved.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "This piece may have been commissioned by Men and crafted by the Dwarves. It is known the races traded freely between each other and, in turn, with the Elves.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"\"This piece may have been commissioned by Men and crafted by the Dwarves. It is known the races traded freely between each other and, in turn, with the Elves."},{"descriptiong":"Many fine wares would find their way into Mordor via trade facilitated by the Sea of Núrnen. Such trade routes have closed, possibly with finality, with the return of the Uruks.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Isn't it lovely, dear? The Dwarves made this!"},{"descriptiong":"You've been drinking. You smell like a mule who's gotten into the rotgut."},{"descriptiong":"It's a fine anniversary present! Look at the craftsmanship!"},{"descriptiong":"Our anniversary was last week."},{"descriptiong":"It was brought in from the sea!"},{"descriptiong":"You mean you won this at the tavern. My husband. Get in the house.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "It's never good news. Naw, and I saw to it he didn't…
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Herald's parchment, Third Age, 2941"},{"descriptiong":"\"Bad news has wings,\" the saying goes. So it was with the dispatches from Erebor, heralding the Orcs' great defeat at the Battle of the Five Armies. This particular scroll made its way into Mordor carried by a messenger whose ill tidings were received less than warmly by his comrades. Though the courier's identity was never revealed, he was referred to by the Uruks, with great affection, as 'dinner.'"},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"It's never good news.\nNaw, and I saw to it he didn't…"},{"descriptiong":"All right, you stinking lot. Shut your gobs."},{"descriptiong":"SHUT IT!"},{"descriptiong":"Got some terrible news, here. Terrible. Once again the filthy Humans sided with the Dwarves who had help from those sanctimonious bastards the Elves who were rescued by - and I am not making this up - the damned giant Eagles to slaughter thousands of our brethren in what we should all be calling the battle to unfairly gang up on the Orcs."},{"descriptiong":"Our lands get invaded, our chieftains killed, and our people murdered. Where does it end? Well, I tell you, it ends here. And it ends right now! They can't stop the march of progress. They can't stop us!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Show me the carving…
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Scrimshaw, Third Age, circa 2940"},{"descriptiong":"This carved tusk commemorates the conclusion of an epic hunt. Here we see two Dwarves: the first is wielding a mighty axe and striking a deadly blow against a giant Mumak. The other, who appears to be his twin, flees from the beast in a panic. The quality of the workmanship indicates that the artist was a master craftsman under the influence of strong ale."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"There, it's finished… a true masterwork. What a fine carving. The front, I etched us killing this here Mûmak. And the back… our next prize, The Mighty Graug! A beast like that is a hunter's legacy."},{"descriptiong":"Show me the carving…"},{"descriptiong":"Isn't it magnificent? Such detail! Look at me striking the mighty beast. Blood everywhere."},{"descriptiong":"And why am I etched running away from the Mûmak in terror?"},{"descriptiong":"Artistic license, brother Torvin! If you want to be the hero, I suggest next time you make the carving!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Gather what you can and run. Quickly, before the others see you. You shouldn't be let to starve. Quickly, now. Go, go!"
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Wooden Handle, formerly part of a mushroom basket, Third Age, circa 2930"},{"descriptiong":"\"This utterly unremarkable basket has seen better days."},{"descriptiong":"Few, if any, of the Outcasts' possessions have survived. In bygone days, this basket would likely have been carried by a woman on her daily errands, and used to carry all manner of goods.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Stop! Do not move. By order of Gondor, trespassing on the Morannon is punishable by death!"},{"descriptiong":"Do not - a woman? The Outcasts now send women alone to steal from us."},{"descriptiong":"Do your worst, Ranger. But I will fight."},{"descriptiong":"You are but skin and bones…"},{"descriptiong":"I can still fight."},{"descriptiong":"Gather what you can and run. Quickly, before the others see you. You shouldn't be let to starve. Quickly, now. Go, go!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Memory Audio
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Scrimshaw, Third Age, circa 2940"},{"descriptiong":"This carved tusk commemorates the conclusion of an epic hunt. What a fine carving. The front, I etched us killing this here Mûmak. And the back… our next prize, The Mighty Graug! A beast like that is a hunter's legacy."},{"descriptiong":"Show me the carving…"},{"descriptiong":"Isn't it magnificent? Such detail! Look at me striking the mighty beast. Blood everywhere."},{"descriptiong":"And why am I etched running away from the Mûmak in terror?"},{"descriptiong":"Artistic license, brother Torvin! If you want to be the hero, I suggest next time you make the carving!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: And there's the first throat I'll cut!"
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Pickaxe, Orcish, Third Age, 2942"},{"descriptiong":"Uruk refer to mining as \"working the black seam,\" as they extract iron and adamant from the earth to fuel their war machine. They are adept miners, and oftentimes use steel pickaxes such as this one to extract ore. Now, however, the pickaxes are in the hands of slaves, and the Uruks serve as overseers."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Black Captains and Uruk-hai. Damned if I can't tell who's worse, and why are we working for these fools in the first place? We should be in charge."},{"descriptiong":"Come on! Don't you want to crack the whip instead of having it cracked over you?"},{"descriptiong":"You'll be the death of us, talking like that."},{"descriptiong":"Here, now. Think I'm talking about talk? I'm talking about…"},{"descriptiong":"Less whining, more mining!"},{"descriptiong":"And there's the first throat I'll cut!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column3: Medallion Half 1, The Two Trees of Valinor
column5: I've done all I can. We've called for one of your people, but I don't… in the meantime, why don't you tell me about that? The medallion you're holding…
column6: Medallion Half 1, The Two Trees of Valinor
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Shattered Medallion Half, The Two Trees of Valinor, Second Age, circa 3430"},{"descriptiong":"Across Mordor the Two Trees of Valinor are recognized as a symbol of the light of creation and of the ancient bond between Elves and Men. This medallion half, crafted by the Elves, commemorates the original two trees of legend, whose scions now survive only in the White Tree of Gondor."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"All right… hold still. I'm afraid to say, it's going to…"},{"descriptiong":"Aaaaaaggggh!"},{"descriptiong":"…it's going to hurt."},{"descriptiong":"I've done all I can. We've called for one of your people, but I don't… in the meantime, why don't you tell me about that? The medallion you're holding…"},{"descriptiong":"You just want to distract me. Very well. These are the Two Trees of Valinor… a symbol of the endless cycle: Life, death, and rebirth. Come closer, and I will tell you their tale. We must…"},{"descriptiong":"…I fear we must distract ourselves from the grim happenings of this day.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: Branding Iron, Orcish, Third Age, 2942
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Branding Iron, Orcish, Third Age, 2942"},{"descriptiong":"\"Not Old Scorchy!\" is a common refrain among the Orcs of Udûn. It is interesting to note that while branding with red-hot irons as punishment is commonplace, with the Orcs searing the flesh of their unruly brethren as much as they do their slaves, Old Scorchy is unique, used only on the most recalcitrant."},{"descriptiong":"The Orcs believe Scorchy holds sorcerous powers enabling it to burn longer and hotter, and to scorch with such intensity the pain can be felt for weeks after the branding.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"All right, you. You're not so brave now, are you? Hold 'em, boys."},{"descriptiong":"Get your filthy hands off me!"},{"descriptiong":"It's simple, see? Do unto others quicker and harder than they'd do unto you. But at least you tried. Next time, try harder. This is going to hurt. A lot. But you'll learn who's in charge."},{"descriptiong":"No! Not… not Old Scorchy! Anything but Old Scorchy!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: It's a fine anniversary present! Look at the craftsmanship!
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"\"This piece may have been commissioned by Men and crafted by the Dwarves. It is known the races traded freely between each other and, in turn, with the Elves."},{"descriptiong":"Many fine wares would find their way into Mordor via trade facilitated by the Sea of Núrnen. Such trade routes have closed, possibly with finality, with the return of the Uruks.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Isn't it lovely, dear? The Dwarves made this!"},{"descriptiong":"You've been drinking. You smell like a mule who's gotten into the rotgut."},{"descriptiong":"It's a fine anniversary present! Look at the craftsmanship!"},{"descriptiong":"Our anniversary was last week."},{"descriptiong":"It was brought in from the sea!"},{"descriptiong":"You mean you won this at the tavern. My husband. Get in the house.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "Sir, the situation is very confused…
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Lockpick, Second Age"},{"descriptiong":"This simple metal prod is a burglar's best friend. The pick is small and easily concealed; it can be palmed or even hidden under the tongue with minimal effort. In the hands of a skilled thief, the pick can be used to quickly and quietly defeat most locks of non-magical origin."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Sir, the situation is very confused…"},{"descriptiong":"How is it confused? I see the prisoners escaping, running towards the gates, which seem to have flown open by sorcery or sabotage."},{"descriptiong":"Archers, stand down!"},{"descriptiong":"Sir?"},{"descriptiong":"We're not wasting good arrows on those people. They've served their purpose: They're damned, they're damned well out of my hair. Mordor can take the whole stinking lot of them."},{"descriptiong":"And send my compliments to the captain of the gates. I suppose he sent me this lockpick as some sort of joke.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: And send my compliments to the captain of the gates. I suppose he sent me this lockpick as some sort of joke."

Mordor can take the whole stinking lot of them."},{"descriptiong":"And send my compliments to the captain of the gates. I suppose he sent me this lockpick as some sort of joke.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "The Orcs are making things mighty difficult. This might be my last run in a long while.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Lockbox Key, Third Age, circa 2930"},{"descriptiong":"This key was crafted long ago by the locksmiths of Khazad-Dûm. It is able to open a wide array of locks. It would be of great value to a burglar or spy."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"The Orcs are making things mighty difficult. This might be my last run in a long while."},{"descriptiong":"My wife and I… we need to… be… elsewhere."},{"descriptiong":"The lockbox. Open it. Now."},{"descriptiong":"Wh-why?"},{"descriptiong":"These are hard times, and I need to know you can pay. Up front."},{"descriptiong":"Well, now. That's hardly enough for both."},{"descriptiong":"We've always… that's all I have! Please, my wife!"},{"descriptiong":"Should've saved more. Now: Room for one on the boat. You decide…\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

[{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Crushed giant Spider egg shell, Third Age, circa 2938"},{"descriptiong":"\"This Ungol egg has clearly been kept as a memento, but for what reason? Does it represent yet another casualty in the burgeoning war in Mordor, the one being fought between the forces of Sauron and the children of Queen Shelob? Or is this just a remnant of some Uruk's supper?\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"I speak with the Mouth of Sauron, the second Dark Lord of this Middle-earth. Our will is his will. Mordor is ours, and fairly won. You will take this message from Sauron back to your spider Queen Shelob, the last daughter of Ungoliant."},{"descriptiong":"Your eggs will not be allowed to hatch in Mordor. Your children will no longer prey on the Morgai Flies. You will depart this realm, abandon your nests in Nan Ungol."},{"descriptiong":"You have grown fat on our generosity. We have fed you as we would a pet, allowed you to run unfettered. This ends now. Our union, as it was, has ended. Our will is irresistible. We have spoken.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column3: Medallion Half 1, The Two Trees of Valinor
column5: In-Game Description
column6: Medallion Half 1, The Two Trees of Valinor

We must…"},{"descriptiong":"…I fear we must distract ourselves from the grim happenings of this day.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "The damn flies seem to be following me. I can't hardly go nowhere without them buzzing around.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Coded journal entry #3, Third Age, circa 2941"},{"descriptiong":"This parchment contains a note, but its author and intended recipient remain, ultimately, unrevealed. Is this a dispatch of some kind? A recounting of great deeds? Poetry? The note is coded and its message remains indecipherable."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"The damn flies seem to be following me. I can't hardly go nowhere without them buzzing around."},{"descriptiong":"I was going to scout Thaurband, the slave city. The Orcs got a prison there, and enough people in chains to run the mines and the mills and make the city go. But there it was, one stinking fly. I could hear it buzzing, but couldn't see it or squash it."},{"descriptiong":"Thing was following me, I swear. I was out on a skiff, middle of the Sea of Núrnen and the fly was coming along for the ride. Like it knew! Following me, like. All the time: ZZZZZ ZZZZZ."},{"descriptiong":"I can't get the buzzing and humming to stop. It don't matter whether I'm sleeping or eating or squatting. I can hear 'em. They're in my damned head!"},{"descriptiong":"MAKE… 'EM… STOP!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: "Where'd you get off to, child?
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Strange Rock (volcanic) Second Age, circa 1600"},{"descriptiong":"\"Orodruin's eruptions are sudden and violent. When the mountain awakes in fire, none are safe. The skies darken with smoke and ash, and fiery rocks are shot high into the air before landing with deadly force."},{"descriptiong":"This glassy, obsidian stone is one of those volcanic rocks; it dates back to the Second Age, perhaps to when the Dark Lord formed his initial bond with the volcano. These remnants of Orodruin's fury are prized for their hardness. They are often sharpened to make weapons.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Where'd you get off to, child?"},{"descriptiong":"I found this, daddy."},{"descriptiong":"This kind of rock is very rare. It comes from the volcano. There!"},{"descriptiong":"Now, Doom is a foul place, angry and mean. It will explode when Sauron is near and plotting, spitting all manner of foulness into the air: smoke and dust and rocks that burn the ground. It does this as a warning: I will not stay silent for long!"},{"descriptiong":"Sort of like your mother."},{"descriptiong":"Don't tell your mother I said that."},{"descriptiong":"So this rock is…"},{"descriptiong":"It is a rock, nothing more. And you needn't be afraid of a rock. Or Doom, which is silent to this very day."},{"descriptiong":"And, sweetie, if you need a lesson from all this, why, here's a fine one: Even a foul place like that volcano can produce beautiful things.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column3: Medallion Half 1, The Two Trees of Valinor
column5: "All right… hold still. I'm afraid to say, it's going to…

[{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Graven idol representing Morgoth, Second Age, circa 3318"},{"descriptiong":"\"Before Númenor's fall, its priests and dark acolytes held sacrifices to strange gods in the temples, and graven idols such as these were freely worshipped."},{"descriptiong":"This idol represents Morgoth, the first Dark Lord of Middle-earth, and was likely carried to the mainland by missionaries seeking to spread his vile message.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Pharazon!"},{"descriptiong":"He's been sold a bill of goods, all right! And what do we get? More war! More taxes! Ha! Human sacrifice in the town square! You can hear the screams, all day and all night, and we're made to worship this, this hideous thing. The great tree, kindling! The king's ears filled with rubbish from his…"},{"descriptiong":"…his advisor, the great chained wonder, Sauron, now princely Sauron."},{"descriptiong":"Eilindel is right! Númenor is ruined, and the boats can't take us away from this charnel house fast enough!\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column3: Beasts of The Land : Great Beast

column5: "The skies over Mordor are being cleared by fell beasts, the Hell-hawk. Crows such as this poor fellow are hunted relentlessly, but not as food.
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Dead Crow carrying Coded Journal Entry #1"},{"descriptiong":"\"The skies over Mordor are being cleared by fell beasts, the Hell-hawk. Crows such as this poor fellow are hunted relentlessly, but not as food."},{"descriptiong":"No, crows are hunted because each of the oversized black birds is a potential spy, a messenger who might be carrying news to a master outside of Mordor. This crow met its doom trying to deliver a coded note.\""},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Here's what I saw: I told you the Orcs are digging everywhere. Well, they dug huge caves into the ground in the side of the hills and into the mountains where they do their work. Some of it is forges, and they've got blacksmiths making armor and all kinds of weapons. They save on metal by making their armor for the front only, like they're not planning on retreating anymore."},{"descriptiong":"Oh, and they've got these huge pits, too, bigger'n I've ever seen. They pull the new Orcs, maybe a hundred or so a day, and some of them are those Uruk-hai. You can tell them right away because they've got a head or so on other Orcs, they come out fighting, and immediately start bossing everyone else around."},{"descriptiong":"No-one's the wiser about me spying. But don't send no more crows! The other Orcs might get suspicious.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: In-Game Description
column7: [{"descriptiong":"In-Game Description"},{"descriptiong":"Torn Banner, Third Age, circa 2940"},{"descriptiong":"Ungol have set upon and partially consumed this crimson banner representing the Dark Lord Sauron. This is not merely a symbolic act; the oversized children of Shelob are organizing against the Uruks, forming raiding parties to bring down what they consider to be invaders into their lands. Whatever truce may have existed between the factions has now ended."},{"descriptiong":"Memory Audio"},{"descriptiong":"\"Damn. They got the whole raiding party. And et the flag."},{"descriptiong":"See the webs? It's Spiders. Filthy creatures. Likely coming up from the valley down south."},{"descriptiong":"We should clear it out."},{"descriptiong":"You should shut your big yap. Don't nobody come back from that place."},{"descriptiong":"Wonder if they're working for Shelob? Sauron used to feed her, and I guess she don't remember whose pet she is. It might be time for a reminder.\""},{"descriptiong":""}]

column5: I hide outside the camp, and pray they do not find me. They are taking anyone they find into slavery.

They are taking anyone they find into slavery."},{"descriptiong":"If only you were here, but I know you must fight the Uruks or there will be no chance any of us will ever be free."},{"descriptiong":"I fear I will never see you again."},{"descriptiong":"If they find me, I do not know how long I can survive."},{"descriptiong":"Your beloved wife, Eryn\""},{"descriptiong":""}]
